Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: MsLiviaT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the "Studio", which is a lovely apartment in a separate building. We had all comforts, the room was perfectly clean, good choice of food at breakfast, and the whole staff was super friendly. We couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “The service is what really sets this place apart”
Reviews.Author: LLandry
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Zandbergen on the advice of a friend who is from the area. We were very pleased with our stay. It's really more of a B&B than a hotel, so do not go expecting anything fancy. There are steep stairs leading to the rooms, as in many European hotels, so keep this in mind. Henk helped us with our bags. All the staff we encountered seemed to genuinely enjoy making their guests' stay as pleasurable as possible. Henk was ever present, speaking to each guest at breakfast in their native language, offering tips and suggestions and making sure everyone's coffee was topped up. Breakfast was plentiful, with cereals, fruit, hard boiled eggs, ham, cheese and a selection of breads, including very tasty, warm croissants. We stayed in Room 5 which had an expansive balcony overlooking a lovely garden - it's a shame the weather did not permit us to enjoy it much. There were a few kinks - a burn-out bulb on one side of the bed and a some towels missing on days 2 and 3, but to be fair, we did not point these things out to staff and have no doubt they would have been rectified quickly had we done so. We would not hesitate to stay here again and would recommend it highly to our friends. It was within easy walking to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, especially if you cut through the Vondelpark (which is a destination in itself), and a short tram ride to Old Amsterdam, with a tram stop just steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely B&B, best smelling breakfast”
Reviews.Author: uratargetmarket
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a small, single room in September 2011 for a brief, solo visit to Amsterdam whilst between jobs. As covered before, Hank is just so lovely and friendly. I was quite lazy getting out of bed and missed breakfast both days but he still brought me over some whilst I sat his computer about 11am. When I checked out, he also waived any charges for what I'd drunk out of the minibar. The B&B is in a nice, neighbourhood location. I wouldn't say it is an amazing location if you are older or don't like walking. The tram stop isn't that far away at all, but unfortunately for me that tram stop was closed when I stayed at Hotel Zandbergen. My only one small criticism of the B&B is that when I booked with them I asked for directions from the airport (using the trams) and they never did think to tell me that tram line was shut- which meant I got quite lost for an hour or so on my way to check-in. Other than that though- you can't really fault the place. My room was small but perfectly pleasant and well kept. Comfy bed and good TV. Well stocked mini bar. You're not staying at a top hotel, this is a family run B&B. But in terms of "you get what you pay for" you absolutely get value for money here. Plus I very much liked the neighbourhood setting, and Hanks music in the mornings!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: mkh1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel zandbergen for a few nights in April. We were really impressed by the professionalism and friendliness of the manager Henk, and his staff , Anita, Elena and Tessa. Their local knowledge, advice and overall willingness to assist was extremely helpful.Breakfast was well presented and more than adequate with a section of ham, cheese, bread, croissants, billed eggs , fruit and cereals. Coffee and tea were always available free of charge. We also appreciated free wifi access. There is no lift and the stairs are extremely steep so if this presents a problem maybe request a first floor room.Having said this Henk kindly carried one of our bags upstairs. The exceptional service tends to override the few shortcomings of the rooms. Our room although extremely clean did look tired and needed an 'update' . The bed was very large and positioned against the wall with no room for a bedside table, making it necessary to climb out of the bottom of the bed.Many of the wall lights did not work nor did the hairdryer- however we did not in fairness comment about this to management as this was not a problem for us.Overall a very pleasant stay as the hotel is in a very good centrallylocated area with lots of great eating places and easy access to major attractions. Simply could not fault the professionalism and generosity of the staff. Tip: the hotel ordered us a taxi to the wharf which turned out to be a private transfer service. The cost of the trip was more than expected at 23 euros. This was not an issue but when the driver was offered 30 euros in two notes he said he had no change. When we offered to round it up to 25 euro and for him to provide us a 5 euro note he still insisted he had no change. Luckily we found some small change otherwise we would have had no choice but to offer him a exorbitant 7 euro tip, which may have been his preferred option. Make sure you have small change to avoid a similar experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Top B & B.”
Reviews.Author: Phromily
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week here mid-March 2012. Couple 61/61. Holidaying. Stay based on Trip Advisor comments. We were not disapointed. This is a great little B & B. Hospitality was excellent. The manager 'Henk' and staff could not do enough to us. Room was spacious, clean and well decked out as one would expect in a B & B. Breakfasts were ample to get you going for the day. Location is excellent. Tram stop 20M from front door. 10mins by tram into city centre (Tip: Buy yourself a one day ticket on the tram. The trams go everywhere). Local dining excellent (Tip: out the front door turn left, 50M up the street on the corner is a pub / wine bar with great meals. Otherwise out the front door turn right down to the first interstection turn right and 50m up on your left is a great Italian resturant on a corner. Both these places have meals and wine very reasonably priced). Museums everywhere! (Tip: Buy a Museum Pass, 45E, at the first museum you go to. It covers most of the museums inlcuding the Anne Frank and Rembrandt Houses. It was the best investment we made in Amsterdam. At the end of your stay give the card back to 'Henk' at the hotel and he will reimburse you 10E for each card!). There is enough to see in Amsterdam to keep you busy for a week but suggest do as we did each day and just take the time to stop, have a coffee (wine) somewhere in thw sun and watch the locals go by. While in Amsterdam we also did the Volendam, Windmills tour, the Rotterdam / Hague tour and also toured to Brussels, Antwerp. All worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rekacs2556
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week at Hotel Zandbergen at the end of March and would return in a heartbeat to this wonderful hotel. As other travelers have noted, the charming personal service offered by owner Henk de Lugt, his assistant Anita Doerga, and the rest of the staff, is unparalleled. The location on tramline #2 in a leafy quiet neighborhood near Vondelpark and the museums is perfect - full of restaurants, cafes, and grocery and other shopping. The extensive European-style breakfasts are delicious, served in a sunny room with classical music playing. (Another morning pleasure is listening to Henk switching effortlessly among several languages as he chats with different guests.) We stayed in an apartment next door to the main hotel, which was so comfortable that we wanted to stay forever. This is the place!

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel Zandbergen & Henk! Excellent service! Very Family-Friendly & Great location!”
Reviews.Author: IkeEwell
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and my 7 year old twin boys stayed at the Hotel Zandbergen for 3 days, March 24th -27th. We were able to catch the train from the airport to Central Station and then take the #2 tram, basically to the hotel's front door. It was very easy to get to and just minutes from the center of town. We rented the penthouse which was lovely and had an amazing view. There was plenty of space for the 4 of us. The entire staff's customer service was top notch. Henk also knows the city extremely well. His recommendations were spot on. 2 of the highlights of our trips were recommendations from Henk: 1. The Public Library - literally the best library we've ever seen. We hung out in the library twice. Trust me, you've gotta visit. 2. The Blue boat canal tour was excellent!. We were well taken care of. We were only actually supposed to stay at the Hotel Zandbergen for 2 days (3/24-3/36), and then fly out to Abu Dhabi on the 26th. However, when we arrived at the airport on Monday, March 26th to fly to Abu Dhabi on Lufthansa airlines, my wife and I were told that although our passports were sons' passports weren't valid "enough". We were told that although our passports were valid, our boys' passports weren't. Their passports are valid until April 23, 2012, and we return to the states on April 12th and were told that all of our passports were fine for travel. That's besides the point. Back to why we LOVE Hotel Zandbergen. When Lufthansa refused to make an exception on the passport issue and refused to change our flight to the next day, we immediately called Henk and explained the situation. Henk, knew exactly what to do. He told us to take a cab back to the hotel and where he'd be waiting outside to grab all of our luggage so that we could continue on to the Consulate. Henk said that we needed to drop off all of our luggage because the consulate wouldn't allow you to have anything but your ID. He was right. We were able to get emergency passports for our boys and booked another flight on another airline to reach Dubai/Abu Dhabi. We were able to stay an additional day at the wonderful Hotel Zandbergen and in lovely Amsterdam, where the weather was simply beautiful. If it were not for ALL of Henk's assistance with the advice on how to navigate the consulate and rebooking us in his hotel To top it off, the accommodations were spacious with the great views, the breakfast was healthy, plentiful and coffee was delicious. My family and I can't imagine staying anywhere else when we're in Amsterdam next. Thanks Hotel Zandbergen & Henk! The Vaughn-Ewells

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, great location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Judy A
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Hotel Zandbergen since 1992. It boasts a great location near Vondel Park, convenient to public transportation and many tourist sites. The hotel itself is quiet and comfortable, perfect for families with young kids. My family loved the breakfast -- warm croissants every morning and made-to-order coffee. Best of all, the staff goes out of its way to make guests feel at home and help them enjoy their stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The right choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lindstaedt
Reviews.Content: Personalized service (Mr. Hank, thanks for all tips), warmth, tranquility. If you want something different from traditional hotelÂ´s chains go to Hotel Zandbergen. Satisfaction guaranteed. I still remember the delicious breakfast with the sound of a beautiful classical music, the comfort of the room, the proximity of the park and museums ... Definitively my new address in the next trip to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: icebrg
Reviews.Content: The first thing about this hotel that comes to my mind is SERVICE! With Hank's personal supervision and service - you can't miss... We've booked for 3 nights, enjoyed the city,,, Hank was extremely helpful in how to find good places, checked for our well being daily and gave many tips on bikes,Museums and places to go and see. There are also discount tickets for some places at hotel that worth checking out. Also the hotel itself isn't new and the rooms is a bit small for my taste, but it is well kept and good daily service compensates for that minuses. The stairs are steep as told in other reviews... try to take 1st floor... :-) All in all it was a positive experience with superb service and very good location. I've never seen hotel manager so personally invilved and attending his customers needs in the way Hank did. A+! Will go there again,,,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, helpful and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Cos C
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend in Amsterdam and decided to book the Hotel Zandbergen after reading a few other reviews and doing the usual homework. The first thing to say is that Henk and all his staff were extremely polite and helpful, and always seemed to have good advice for any issue or question we had about the city. It was my wife's birthday and they also provided her with some flowers and a nice bottle of drink which made the stay even more homely. The hotel itself was good - we had opted for the larger apartment, and the rooms were comfortable, well serviced and clean with daily maid service. The decor is a little dated so if you like your surroundings a touch modernistic you may be disappointed, bit there is free wireless available, and Henk also tells me that an extensive re-furb will be carried out soon. There are some steep stairs to negotiate, that are typical of the city - something to bear in mind. Breakfast was of the basic cereal/croissant/ham and cheese variety, but all perfectly adequate and with the staff's personal service in evidence. Location is just south of the main city, but very near the main museums and walkable. There is a tram stop just by the hotel that is very convenient and will take you into the city if you forget your walking shoes! All in all, a nice stay with the type of service that you would like to have everywhere. I look forward to staying there again, particularly after the re-furb. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It's always good to be well served”
Reviews.Author: pierodavila
Reviews.Content: Zandbergen is a hidden gem. Small, located in a quiet neighborhood just outside the Vondelpark and 3 blocks away from the Van Gogh Museum. Family managed, what you find here is not commom. Cosy atmosphere, competent people, decent price in a fair and nice room. A good breakfast, tram right off the door, the only con is the stair... oh, the stairs in Amsterdam... But I would come back many times and, if asked, would recommend for all my TripAdvisor friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ferry41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outside of the centre of Amsterdam, but it is very easy to get into town with the frequent tram 2. Very friendly people in charge who bend over backwards to help you enjoy your stay. The single room was quite small but fine, though the sink in the shower was a bit of a squeeze. Breakfast was good with a range of fruit on offer. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good breakfast and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: CC025
Reviews.Content: Myself and a couple of mates visited amsterdam and stayed in a triple room in the basement at the front of the hotel. The room was very clean and the single beds were comfortable. The bathroom was also very clean and reasonably spacious. Breakfast consisted of a choice of cereals, juices, youghurt, cheeses, meats, fruits, croissants and rolls. On the second day they even had chocolate brownies! The hotel is located on tramline 2 near vondel park and there is a tramstop outside the entrance. It is about a 5 minute walk from the Van Gogh Musuem. It was therefore not in the centre so fairly quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WEEROSIE
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location for us. A 15 minute walk took you into the nearest station for the 'water bus'. On arrival at the hotel (late arrival) the lady at the reception was extremely helpful. Our room was perfect for us - a little small - but managable with ensuite facilities. Breakfast was great, with a selection of cereals, fruit juice, fresh fruit basket, breads, croissants, ham and cheese - wonderful coffee !! Great value for money. The staff were very helpful, giving advice on tourist attractions and supplied us with a map. You can purchase tickets for some of the museums, etc at the hotel, which saved us standing in a queue for the VanGogh museum. When in Amsterdam, buy the 24 hr hop-on, hop-off ticket which takes you around the waterways of the city and from there you can get your bearings as to the proximity of one attraction is to another. Anne Frank's house and the VanGogh museum is a must. The streets off Dam Sq are fabulous for shopping. Wonderful restaurants to suit all tastes opposite the Central Station waterbus - opposite the Grasshopper hotel, which leads into the redlight district. The hotel also offers taxi transfers to the airport at a set rate - we paid 40 euros on our arrival at the airport but on our departure, the hotel arranged the transfer and the rate had been set at 30 euros. Definately a great hotel in a quiet location but within walking distance to the main city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, near tram stop, in a quiet residential neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: traveling_geek_14
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in a typical Amsterdam house, so expect narrow and quite steep stairs. A quiet residential area with some shops and restaurants, about 10-15 minutes by tram (the stop very close to hotel) from the city center and just 2-3 stops from the major museums. The staff is exceptionally friendly - carried our bags up the stairs even though we said we were fine on our own, remembered our morning coffee and tea orders, offered tea free of charge every evening we came soaked with rain back to the hotel, helped with all questions and even gave us tips for a quicker route to the airport. The room I stayed in was on the small side, but clean, with a recently renovated bathroom, comfortable bed, WI-FI, minibar, hairdryer, small tv. Breakfast includes freshly baked warm rolls and croissants, toast, cheese, ham, hard-boiled eggs, jams, sweet spreads and several kinds of fruit. I slept well, felt taken care of and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: deepak2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in Nov 2011. Our apartment was well equipped with an attached kitchen with all amenities, living space with sofa-set, center table, book-shelf with audio system, dining/working table, comfortable beds and a spacious bathroom with a bath-tub. The strongest point of this hotel was their staff who were very friendly and helpful. On one occasion, when we were trying to book train tickets on-line and the website was not accepting non-European credit cards, one of the staff gladly booked the tickets for us using her own funds. (Of course we did reimburse her in cash). As the hotel did not have elevators, all our heavy luggage was carried through the stairs by the hotel staff, which I think is not too common in Europe. The location of the hotel is in a quiet and peaceful locality with tram stops within close vicinity and cabs available just round the corner. The owner, Mr Henk and his wonderful staff do deserve a round of applause for their effort to keep their guests comfortable and happy. We would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Gunny49er
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little far out but the number 2 tram stops almost right outside of the door within 5 minutes of the Leidseplein. Friendly staff and free internet. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: tripper208
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zandbergen is away from the busiest part of Amsterdam in a quiet and leafy part of town. The disadvantage of this is that either a tram ride or a 20-30 minute walk was required to get to the canals and many of the sites. The advantages were avoiding the crowds and a quiet nights sleep! Henk deserves a round of applause for the fantastic service he provides at Hotel Zandbergen. He went out of his way to ensure I was happy and comfortable and even presented me with a small gift on departure. The room was small but comfortable and clean. Two small gripes; the single bed linen didn't really fit the king single bed and the room was really quite warm overnight with no means to control the temperature apart from opening the window. The breakfast was generous and offered variety. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: parocom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this small hotel. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The location in a quiet residential area across from Vondelpark could not have been better. The number 2 tram provided great access or connections to all areas we wanted to see as well as transport to and from the train station. We purchased Van Gogh Museum tickets from Henk, who was most charming and helpful. We skipped the tram and enjoyed a pleasant walk back to the Zandenberg after our museum visit. Breakfast was good each morning and served in a very pleasant and cheerful room. Our room, although small, was comfortable. Our stay in Amsterdam was greatly enhanced by such a pleasant experience at the Hotel Zandenberg.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff in a great, safe location”
Reviews.Author: Mel_In_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great area of Amsterdam that is considered to be quite posh, however it is a little further away from where all of the nightlife is. We liked this. Having said that, the hotel is very close to Vondelpark, a wonderful park and the main museums. It is also quite close to a tram stop that will get you into the centre of town quite easily. Our room was quite comfortable and very clean, however decor is looking a bit tired. Bathroom was also very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful, they would help us organise activities and knew how to hook us up with good deals. Just be aware that there is no lift in this hotel and the stairs are very steep so not great for people who have walking disabilities. Free wi-fi provided, breakfast buffet fairly standard.

Reviews.Title: “For Amsterdams relation, a nice family place.”
Reviews.Author: distance10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice 3 star family place, with spacious rooms and comfortable beds. Avoid the taxis, if you are arriving by train and just take tram 2 from the Central Station (buy your ticket in side at â‚¬ 2,60 pp) and take 3rd stop after Van Gogh. The hotel staff and especially the hotel manager are very friendly, but the 127 euro per night + taxes seems to be too overpriced, even if it is inclusive breakfast and Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CarlLarson
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zandbergen is a typical European 2 star hotel. My room was very small and dated, although clean. I had a room on the 2nd floor in the front, so street noise was a big problem during the day, but it was not an issue in the evening when trying to sleep. The breakfast buffet was basic with no hot items. The hotel has a great location, away from the crowds in the city center but conveniently located a half block form the #2 tram. I really like the neighborhood area, which is charmingly residential with lots of nice restaurants, bars and shops. The staff is very nice and attentive. Wifi reception in the room was available 100% of the time, although I would occasionally experience some slowdowns. For the price I paid, the hotel is a good value compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded us of a college dorm”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaAnne
Reviews.Content: Very basic. Served its purpose of being a clean, warm,safe place with easy access to public transportation (Tram #2). A fifteen to 20 minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum, and across the street from a very nice park (which we did not visit - too cold and rainy). By all appearances it is in a nice area of Amsterdam. However, not the hotel for those in search of luxury. Not the hotel for those with cardiac conditions or who may be out of shape, either. After a steep trek up two winding staircases carrying heavy luggage, we were placed in a very small room, with plastic bedside tables and virtually no amenities. Breakfast was basic, as well. As mentioned in other reviews, the staff was helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Only complaint is the price”
Reviews.Author: DenverBob55
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with excellent staff. Room and bathroom were a little smallish, but not a problem. We had a room in the back, so we had no issues with street noise. Breakfasts were above average. Henk and his staff are all very helpful, warm and courteous. Hotel is located right next to the tram stop, so it is very conveniently located. The neighborhood is mostly residential and very nice. Major museums are walking distance if you don't mind a nice walk. Thought the price was a little on the high side, although this is a major city so I do not know if we could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Zandbergen, every thing that is good about a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: stefanSittingDown
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Zandbergen for years. Henk took over a few years back & continued the high standard of personal service set by the previous owners. All the staff seem to really care about the guests & this is what makes this a great place to stay. The rooms may be small by international standards but this is not unusualfor Amsterdam. The rooms are well equipped & spotless. The Zandbergen is on a quiet street with a stop for the no. 2 tram near by, this gives easy access to all that Amsterdam has to offer. In the imediate area is the Vondal Park & loads of excelent place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “If you visit Amsterdam, stay at Zandbergen!”
Reviews.Author: JannaDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 3 days in October and our only complaint was that our visit was too short! Hotel's staff is exemplary and the location is perfect. The hotel is within walking distance from Museumplein and Vondelpark, on a quiet street, with Tram 2 stop nearby to take you to the City's Center in just minutes. The staff is very friendly and helpful, whether serving delicious breakfast, helping with directions, dinner reservations or printing our boarding passes. So, if you visit Amsterdam, stay at Zandbergen, I sure will when I return to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great host, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda B
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 days here and , after combing the city, agreed that we would not have wanted to stay in any other area. The hotel itself was perfect for our needs and Henk sets a brilliant standard for service and care. We were in a small room, downstairs in the back, which opened onto a garden and was very quiet and comfortable. Any requests were quickly and cheerfully accommodated. Breakfast was delicious and the coffee is really good ( a must for me!) If I return to Amsterdam I would want to stay here again. There is an excellent small cafe just half a block away and many more restaurants within 10 minutes walk. And the tram stop is extremely convenient. We arrived by train and took the tram directly from Centraal Station to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly helpful staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: lovetheunexpected
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just come back from a 3 night stay at Hotel Zandbergen. We travelled with 3 other couples & everyone agreed that the hotel was great. I booked via email & everything was very clear & easy, I think Hank specialises in making things clear & easy, on arrival each couple was given a note with details of cost, straightforward explanation of the room/door key with breakfast & checkout times. The rooms are small & well designed with comfortable beds & good toiletries. We had the only room on the main first floor which is the room with the least stairs and has sliding floor to ceiling windows which look out over a little green oasis of a courtyard which the downstairs rooms have access to. Hank, Adele and all of the staff are very helpful, information on trains, booking tickets for Van Gogh museum & reserving restaurant tables, nothing was a problem. There is nice little sitting area with free computer access and gentle classical music playing. The Continental breakfast was good with plenty of choice including warm boiled eggs & tasty granary bread to make your own toast. The location close to Vondel Park with quiet bars & restaurants is excellent and Tram 2 virtually stops outside. Highly recommended Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Family owner provides TLC”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaBecky
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Zandbergen is a fairly small family-owned hotel on Tram Line 2 close to the art museums. Our twin room was small but the bathroom had a lovely shower, plenty of ledges for storing things, free WiFi and room and bathroom were immaculate. The breakfast is quite generous: wonderful Dutch cheeses, ham, croissants, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit and juices, even brownies! The owner and staff are very friendly and helpful and seemed genuinely willing to make sure guests have a good experience in the city. Prices (for Amsterdam) were reasonable considering breakfast is included and booking online apparently saves. The neighborhood has some very good restaurants and is leafy and quiet. Beds are very comfortable too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel/excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Deborah L
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time in Amsterdam and we struck lucky staying at the Zandbergen. Very good location, close to Van Gogh museum - tram stops very close by. Henk and his staff were extremely friendly and helpful and recommended how to get around and places to visit. I stayed with 3 friends in a quad room, very clean, very nice roomy bathroom with shower over bath, breakfast was good. Am quite fussy about where to put my head down but would definately stay here again and would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home...”
Reviews.Author: MadeiraIsland
Reviews.Content: A big applause to everyone at Zandbergen...a perfect stay,made us really feel at home. We arrived late about midnight and waiting for us a nice gentleman,taking us to the Studio that we have booked and helping us with our luggage. The next day at breakfast we met Mr. Henk, and i must say, that is not easy to find a person with so much caracther and passion in his job,making each guest feeling special,and my family really felt the magic passed by Mr. Henk. Zandbergen is a nice hotel,we have booked a studio and were very happy with our choice,a big room,kitchinette and balcony; perfect! By the hotel there is tram nr 2 leading you towards Amsterdam city center, a city that i would describe as a postcard!! By the hotel there are some shops,restaurants and a supermarket. Vondelpark makes part of the magic to relax,just a few steps away from the Hotel. Also a big thank you to the recepcionist Tessa,very professional and always ready to help. Next visit to Amsterdam,we will for sure stay at Zandbergen as well recomment to our friends. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimhawkins63
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam. it is in an uncrowded, elegant, tree-lined street within walking distance of three of the major museums and a beautiful concert hall. The tram stop to take you to the city centre is nearby and a lovely park is a few minutes walk away. The owner is extremely helpful and the service excellent. We spent three nights there last week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: eileendoylecrane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three days at this hotel and were taken care of extremely well. The hotel owner was very attentive, the room was large by European standards, the breakfast was abundant and personally looked after, and all needs were anticipated and accommodated. We would encourage anyone heading to Amsterdam to stay here. They will be glad they did!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: jams69
Reviews.Content: In summary, I pretty much got what I had expected at Hotel Zandbergen. It is a small, simple, friendly hotel a little outside the main tourist sites in Amsterdam, offering great value for money.. I stayed two nights at Hotel Zanbergen on a short trip to Amsterdam with a friend. The hotel is located in a nice neighbourhood, with a few cafes and bars, within walking distance of the Van Gogh museum and a tram ride away from the centre. There hotel is located midway between two stops, so taking the tram to and from the centre was no problem. The room was not large, but it was clean and simple with space enough for two. Perfect when you are out sightseeing all day and need somewhere comfortable and clean to sleep at night. The hotel is in an old house and the room was on the top floor, so this involved climbing some steep stairs. We didn't mind the exercise and felt that this added to the charm, but I could see that this would not be everyone's cup of tea. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and there was plently to eat at the breakfast. The fresh croisants were a definite bonus. The only minor glitch we had was with the booking. We had booked and paid by telephone and confirmed a late arrive (between 22:00 and 23:00). We were told that this was OK and received an email from the hotel confirming the reservation. On arrival we were told by the reception staff that they had no record of our booking. The staff were very helpful and thankfully there was a room available. I'm not quite sure what would have happened if the hotel was full, but thanfully that problem did not arrive. Despite this glitch, I would happily stay at Hotel Zandbergen again.

Reviews.Title: “You don't find this type of service anymore!”
Reviews.Author: c_1111
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zandbergen was amazing. It was crafted from what used to be a house, so the feel is extremely home-y. The room we were put in was very spacious, with its own large balcony, and everything was spotless. The owner was also incredible. He offered us croissants and coffee on the house when we arrived (because we had just missed breakfast time) while we waited a few minutes for our room to be ready. The kind of service he offered, you just don't see anymore when you travel. The location was also really great because it was close enough to anywhere you wanted to go, by tram, but away from the loud areas for peaceful nights. Highly highly recommended for anyone spending some time in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Kind service but I will never stay againe”
Reviews.Author: sunshineson
Reviews.Content: -single room 1. no elevator, slope stairs 2. cold(cannot control temperature myself) 3. bathroom is too tiny. shower facility is too bed. hot water is not supply contantly. shower cotten smell >.<

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: InsightBKK
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful service ready to assist with any query, topped by a complementary (and reasonably fast) Internet PC in the lobby. The price was slightly higher than other hotels on our trip, but we were advised on checking out this could be negated somewhat by shopping around various sites for a price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: janpaul42
Reviews.Content: This hotel was instantly inviting. We arrived into Schiphol, caught the train to Central Station then right outside the door of Central Station took #2 Tram to the stop a block from Hotel Zanderbergen. This location is wonderful, nice cafes, the beautiful Vondelpark and walking distance (or tram ride) to all the museums and historic areas. The owner Henk is a perfect host, as are the girls who help him. Breakfast is a wonderful selection of food in a lovely little area, facing the street. The rooms are European style and small, but very comfortable and clean. Although our room faced the street, the windows are substantial and traffic was virtually non existent during the sleeping hours. The stairs are steep and narrow, but there was always an offer from the staff to carry our bags. This is a lovely little hotel which feels like home, we would certainly stay there again next time. It was out of the hustle and bustle of the immediate downtown, but in the heart of a wonderful upmarket residential neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family run hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: Fahey_10
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 year old daughter and I had a very enjoyable stay in Amsterdam recently. Staying at the Hotel Zandbergen meant our visit to the city was very special as it was so lovely staying there. The staff were very friendly and helpful and Henk made an effort with everyone making sure we were very comfortable and offering lots of advice on what to do in Amsterdam. The breakfast was great with fab coffee and it was very clean and quiet. The location is great as you are located in a very quiet area of Amsterdam, very close to the beautiful Vondel park and walking distance to the main museums, Van Gogh, Rijks Museum and the National Museum of Modern Art (Stedelijk Museum) amongst others. The tram is also very close (2) and convenient and there is a good Italian restaurant nearby called Sardegna. The area is lovely, quiet and residential yet very close to walk to shopping areas. We staying in the apartment which was really lovely with a very homely feel and had lovely views over the rooftops. We got plenty of towels, comfortable beds and the room was maintained really well, it had a separate great little kitchen with fridge, microwave and cooker (including plates and cutlery) which meant that you could eat at home. It is a large apartment and the website shows it exactly as it is, in fact it was bigger that we expected. Is is just great for a family or a group of friends and very unusual in that you are in an apartment but also get bed and breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel, check out the website and if you stay in Amsterdam it would be very difficult to beat the Hotel Zandbergen for quality, friendliness, location and value. Thanks to all at the hotel for making our stay so enjoyable, my little girl still talks about the yummy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeOwl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Zandbergen and had a good experience. Firstly the location is excellent. We thought the centre of Amsterdam was a bit rough. A 10 minute tram ride to the Zandbergen gets you to a lovely residential area with a pleasant park and top quality restaurants. The owner is helpful and welcoming ,as is his staff. The rooms are fine, nothing exceptional but clean and comfortable, go for a suite if possible. The breakfast is good and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. A warning, the stairs are practically verticle! The tram goes by the front door and gets you to all the tourist hot spots. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in quiet area close to centre”
Reviews.Author: P0ul
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel is a very pleasant experience. Nice room (No 5 with a spacious balcony), helpful and pleasant staff, breakfast included - which is uncommon in Amsterdam. Nice area, many small cafes and restaurants in the side streets, small shops with not as many customers as in central Amsterdam. 5 minutes with tram line 2 to Leidseplein, 15 minutes to Central Station. I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: explorer1234_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice place to stay, clean, comfortable. We enjoyed our little garden outside our room and staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and assisting our stay in amsterdam. Beds were on the small side and not good for someone with a bad back, but the wifi worked well and is a good location in a quieter area of amsterdam about a 20 minute tram ride from the central station. Would recommend to a friend,or anyone looking for good priced accommodation just a small distance away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “5 star, clean comfortable, amazing staff!!!! Outstanding family accommodations!!”
Reviews.Author: jazzy42
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable accommodations. Easy access to center of town by foot or tram. Staff were very friendly and helpful. They treated our kids ( 11 and 13) like family. Nice continental style breakfast included every morning. They will even do laundry for you if needed.The staff make you feel extremely welcome and comfortable immediately . Highly recommended for families or anyone. First class all the way with no communication issues as all staff speak english. Booked through Expedia and no hiddden costs or surprises at check out.We would absolutely stay at this hotel again for sure.. 5 star service and first class staff!!!! Thank you so much!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: melgede
Reviews.Content: We stayed in AMS for 2.5 days and chose this cute hotel. Location was perfect and great for us because it was in the quiet part of the city and yet you can catch the tram across the hotel and it would only take about 8 mins to get to the center. Walking to the museums from the hotel was perfect. It was a 7 minute walk to the VanGogh and another 5 mins to the Rijks. We were a block away from the Vondelpark if you preferred to sit and enjoy the sun (when it would come out). The people at the front desk (all of them) were very helpful and they all gave a sense of hominess. The hotel was very clean and yet very relaxed in their approach to receiving guests. Our room was spacious and had a nice balcony with chairs. Unfortunately, it was a bit chilly to sit outside when we were there. The room and bathrooms were very clean but the bath towels were a bit small for me. Breakfast was basic. There was no hot food but the selection of cereals, cheeses, meats and breads were delightful and sufficient. Coffee was fresh all the time. There was also an available computer and free internet connection that I found most convenient. This way, you don't need to bring a laptop but can use one when necessary at no cost. Security in the area and at the hotel was not a problem. Henk is a very helpful manager with a good sense of humor. He thought of everything and saw to it his guests had all they needed to know, even details on what to be careful with. He even negotiated a good taxi rate for us to get back to the airport. To and from the airport from the hotel was about 15-20 mins. Another plus for me is that closeby, there are nice cafes and small shops that were not crowded at all. The pharmacy and the church were also very close. It made one feel very at home. We truly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Zandbergen and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Host”
Reviews.Author: SeptemberDalton
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, bus stop very close to hop on to all the sites. But it is close enough to walk to everything if you are in decent physical shape. Our room faced the street and heard no street noise. Had a very nice breakfast each morning. Food like everything else in Amsterdam is expensive.The owner is a great host, very friendly and helpful with sightseeing information. Room on the small side but clean and had very comfortable bed. The stairs are very narrow and very steep.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: LRoger
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and plain, but everything else is top notch. The proprieter and staff really make you feel at home and are extremely helpful. The neighborhood is upscale , quiet, and interesting w/ lots of shops and restaurants. The museams are a short walk or easy tram ride. Nice breakfast in their small dining area. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for families, couples, singles --> everyone”
Reviews.Author: Travel12370
Reviews.Content: Huge family room / apartment. Great location in front of tram line, good access to Schiphol and close to the Vondelpark. Extremely friendly staff, excellent value. Great place to stay in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Kimchinglow
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zandbergen managing director, mr Henk was most helpful and welcoming. Makes our stay at the hotel most enjoyable & memorable. The rest of the staff are courteous and helpful. Our room albeit it being compact is quite compact, it is well design to fully utilise all space without it seem congested. The bathroom modern and clean. Bonus - we got a room leading to a garden where we can sit, read and enjoy the sun. Like all Amsterdam hotel, staircase narrow and hard to navigate with heavy suitcases. However, Henk and his staff are most helpful in carrying your suitcase to your room so not an issue. Breakfast - wide selections of bread ( fresh croissants), fruits, coffee + tea, juices, meat and cheese. The #2 tram to Leidseplein ( central entertainment area) and Central station is only 5 mins walk. Around the hotel are nice cafe, restaurants and fresh organic market. Perfectly located next to Vondelpark where you can spend hours walking, cycling or just sitting i the park to enjoy nature. Two tram stops to museums (Van Gogh & Rijksmuseum). Tickets available from the hotel front desk. Tip: if you staying more than 1 day in Amsterdam, buy the 2/3/4 days tram tickets which also entitle you to hop onto busses. They all belong to the GVB group. Every trip on tram cost you E2.60 so the day ticket will allow you to hop on and off unlimited for 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and would use again”
Reviews.Author: SeanAndCatherine
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed from 29 Mar to 4 Apr 2010 (just writing the review so late TripAdvisor won't let me pick a date earlier than July 2010!). Henk had acquired the apartment next door for expansion and we had the use of it as a family suite for our stay - plenty big enough for 6 of us. Convenient for trams etc. Henk and all staff were cool. Breakfast was friendly and just felt comfortable. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a capital "S"”
Reviews.Author: Tomya1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Amsterdam on an overnight train trip from Budapest (via Munich) at 9:00 a.m. on a Sunday . We arrived at Hotel Zandbergen a little before 10:00 a.m. fully expecting not to be able to check in because of the early hour. Henk and his staff made us welcome instantly by offering coffee, a map, and suggesting things to do nearby while we waited for our room to be ready. They were very busy with guests checking out but managed to get us into our clean room by 11:00 a.m.! We stayed in "Evert's Room," a lovely "apartment" in the building next door to the hotel. We had a kitchen, sitting area bedroom and bath plus a charming balcony that overlooks a lovely garden. We were enjoying our complimentary glass of wine with lunch on our balcony when my husband accidentally closed the balcony sliding door, stranding us on the balcony! Thanks to a friendly neighbor hearing our pleas for help, Henk was summoned and we were rescued. This is just one example of many throughout our stay where the service was outstanding. The beautiful Vondel Park was only a few blocks away. We exercised in the park everyday and used it as a shortcut to the city center. The hotel is also only a few blocks from the Museum Quartier but in a quiet neighborhood so we slept very peacefully. Henk, the owner, and his staff worked tirelessly to make our stay pleasurable, giving sightseeing advice and making sure we were comfortable. We truly felt as if we were staying with friends.

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: norwaykari
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Zandbergen for a week in May. I had already been in Holland 3 weeks prior to booking in. By the way if you book directly with the hotel you are entered into a drawing to win a free night. The hotel i stayed in just before Hotel Z. was far more expensive, and yes it was fancier,but Hotel Zandbergen definitely surpassed the more expensive one in every way, especially in regards to service. Here is where i have to mention Henk the owner. I have never experienced such a perfect balance of professional service with a personal touch. I felt so welcome and safe, and at home. I felt no request would have been denied. I never wanted to leave, and actually extended my vacation by a few days to enjoy more of the hotel and the surrounding areas. The location for me was ideal as i could choose to have a picnic in the park across the street, dine at any one of the fabulous cafes in the neighborhood, or go around the corner to the wine shop and grocery store and prepare my own meal back at the hotel. A quick tram ride and i was right in the center of town. I cant say enough good things about this place. I have already booked in for my next vacation and i am bringing my sisters with me so they can enjoy the same hospitality i did.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: dfwstrider
Reviews.Content: As has been mentioned, accomodations are clean, tram stop is steps away, museum district is a short walk from the hotel. Rates very reasonable for Amsterdam. Wonderful neighborhood by the city park. Safe. But the star of the show, for us, was Henck. The guy is like the energizer bunny. Perpetual motion to satisfy guests. Knowledgable & thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful welcoming place.”
Reviews.Author: sarahl1949
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Zandbergen are terrific -- friendly, welcoming, and helpful. They really go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as they can. The location is good, just a few blocks from the art museums, and with easy access to the tram line. Also, as they say in their website, they do have the best coffee in town!

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome at a delightful hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NTSydney
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I felt welcome and valued as a guest. The owner Henk went out of his way to make sure I had all the information I needed to enjoy my short stay in Amsterdam. I arrived on an early flight from Australia and was able to leave my luggage at reception until the room was ready and go out and explore Amsterdam immediately. As promised the room was ready by 11am ( earlier than official check-in time). The room was immaculate and much thought had gone into ensuring this single room had everything necessary for a comfortable stay. Although there was no lift, Henk took my bags up the narrow staircase both on my arrival and departure which was greatly appreciated. The breakfast buffet which was included in the price was first rate. There was a wide variety of food that was fresh and always replenished and served in a bright and airy dining room with English newspapers on the tables. Henk was always on hand, suggesting activities for the day and engaging in friendly dialogue with guests. The hotel is well located, just outside the noisy centre of town, within walking distance of all the museums and some stylish shops and restaurants. The number 2 tram stopped virtually outside the hotel and was incredibly convenient to access the main station as well as the key places in town. I would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers: solo, couples or families. The warmth of the reception, the location and the standard of the rooms guarantee that I will stay there again next time I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: JackMcEwan
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, good breakfast, slightly expensive. Location makes up for that though.. X

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, nice part of town but rooms could do with updating”
Reviews.Author: Girardina
Reviews.Content: We were made very welcome and can't fault the friendliness of helpfulness of the staff. We were advised to go and see the new library (which wasn't on our list) and it is worth a visit to for the views and the great cafe on the top floor. The hotel is a short ride away from the centre (10 minutes on the No 2 tram - get a day pass much better value) in the museum district (very quiet at night, nice area, several cafes and restaurants nearby). The continental breakfast was plentiful. The room size was normal for europe, it was very clean but rather dated with some odd plastic furniture. It really could do with an update but this did not detract from a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: greybeard50
Reviews.Content: First let me say Henk could not have been more helpfull or professional the entire length of our stay. However, the room we stayed in was very dissapointing given the Zandenberg was listed as 16th out of 338 (and 4th for business).! I felt like an adolescent in a youth hostel not a full paying adult in a hotel. If it had not been for the delightfull view of the neighbouring houses at the back to â€˜watchâ€™ I would have found my time there a little depressing. During our stay they had a student working her school â€˜work experienceâ€™ unit. I witnessed this untrained student, handle food with her hands & her long her not tied up while working at the breakfast cabinet. I would be interested to know how such an establishment earnt a recent Certificate of Excellence from Trip Advisor? Please see photos attached

Reviews.Title: “Small enough to care ...”
Reviews.Author: Exactor
Reviews.Content: The above title was the inscription on the ballpoint pen kindly given to us as a souvenir. It fully expressed the spirit of the hotel, where we spent a very happy and comfortable two nights. The staff, Miriam and Anita, could not have been more helpful and the manager (whose name I think was Lee) was very friendly and welcoming to us and a valuable source of information. The breakfasts were excellent, both in the ambience (with the background classical music) and the quality of the food - in particular the Belgian croissants. We were delighted with our room and the balcony - more like a deck - which we were able to use because of the perfect spring weather. The hotel's location is ideal for sightseeing, yet quiet and restful, with a beautiful, well-tended garden. All in all, a 'home-from-home' in Amsterdam which we have no hesitation in recommending. It is easily reached in less than 20 minutes from Central Station on Tram No 2, which stops 50 metres away. from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElizaBennet1813
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Zandbergen and had a wonderful stay. We got a nice little apartment to ourselves with a kitchen (even though we didn't use it) and a living area. We also had a very comfortable king size bed. The Proprietor of the hotel was very helpful, knowledgeable and very very friendly. The service was impeccable. Free WiFi and breakfast were also a plus. Hotel Zandbergen was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Beautiful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Londoner98
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 night 3 days last week end. The hotel is in a quieter part of the town in the residential Museum distric, 10-15min from both Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. There is even some nice independent chic shopping areas in the vicinity. The tram number 2 is 50 m from your door and takes you to the centre or if you fancy take a troll through Vonderpark. We bought the I amsterdam pass for 3 days 59â‚¬ for free acces to major museaums and transport, see ther site for details: http://www.iamsterdam.com/en/visiting/iamsterdamcard The hotel itself offers all you would expect from a 3 stars and is very clean - and I have seen 3 stars disasters in the UK. Don't expect boutique but the warmth and professionalism of Henk, Anita and team. You are not here to stay in your room so go and discover the beautiful Amsterdam and its so nice and gracious inhabitants! I was back with my partner after visiting as a little kid and now have Amsterdam firmly in my favourite cities list. Please go, the Venice of the orth has much more to offer than you think not the trash hen/stag destination, it is very chic indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Proprieter, simple room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: YvetteMoli
Reviews.Content: This is a small family owned hotel. It is clean and homey, but the best part is Henk, the owner. He is the most hospitable proprietor. He greets you every morning at breakfast with friendly inquiries and suggestions about what to do in Amsterdam. My favorite suggestion was to enjoy a free Wednesday lunch time concert at the Concertgebouw. The room rates are affordable and the location is great for going to the Vondelpark and the Museums. I very much enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really great service at this price! Great bargain.”
Reviews.Author: Castafiore002
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Amsterdam and loved the Zandbergen hotel. It's nice and cozy and the staff is really great, and very helpful. The hotel is well located, easily accessible from the city centre on the number 2 tram, even walkable on a beautiful sunny day. The Rijsk and Van Gogh museums are walking distance from the hotel and a plus is that you can buy tickets to these museums at the hotel (a must, line to these museums is ridiculous). I saved so much time buying my ticket ahead of time, plus saved me from standing outside in the cold. This is a great hotel anfd for the price that I paid for it, a great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like you're home”
Reviews.Author: asemochka_k
Reviews.Content: I love Amsterdam and staying at hotel Zandbergen additionally makes my every trip very lovely and each stay with this hotel is unforgettable. The hotel is located near Vondelpark & close to museum district. The tram stop is a few steps from the hotel which makes it easy to access the other parts of the city. The owner Henk even gave me & my mom a present when were travelling at Christmas. The staff is incredibly helpful & pleasant. At the moment i'm sitting at the hotel & enjoying the classic music & garden view outside. Already planning my next trip to this gorgeous city:) I definitely reccomend this hotel to everyone who want to stay home far away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel Stay in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Sharp_23
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel raving about the friendly service, nice rooms and convenient location. Sounded perfect and we were not disappointed. My husband and two daughters were in Amsterdam for 2 days and this hotel was one of the highlights. My girls loved it. Henk the owner makes you feel right at home and was able to provide all the info we needed, we were able to purchase our tickets for canal cruises, the museum, etc right at the hotel. We rented bikes and also had our airport transportation arranged. Everything was so hassle free and made our vacation so much nicer. We truly felt like were were at home, including our cozy breakfast in the morning. The rooms are very clean and comfortable with the extra details to make you feel right at home. Our location was wonderful, in such a great part of town. We were across the street from Vondelpark, a great starting point for a bike ride. Also right down the street from the VanGogh museum and a little ice skating rink and park. When we arrived at the train station, we just took tram 2, and the driver knew exactly where the hotel was, announcing the name of the hotel for us when we reached our stop. We will definitely go back and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and endlessly helpful service”
Reviews.Author: workingmummy
Reviews.Content: Travelled for work and would definately return to this hotel on any subsequent trips with family. I found it well located and in a pleasant area. The owner was charming and could not have been more helpful with directions, advice and even printing out my boarding pass. Room was quiet, facing the garden side and comfortable. I felt no request was too small. All in all, great value for money in a clean and well-run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home (privately owned, friendly, next to the Vondelpark)”
Reviews.Author: GermanRhino
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel Zandbergen after reading the reviews on this site. They were very positive. After having stayed there, I can say that the high rating is justified. What appealed to me was the hotels location next to the park. Always nice to start a busy day (business and pleasure) in a quiet well kept park. My routine: wake up, jog, shower, have a healthy breakfast, and hit the city center. Because of the location this can be done within the hour. The hotel is on the more upscale side of town. Concert hall, the most popular museums, Leidseplein and Museumplein are within walking distance. As are restaurants serving fresh and healthy foods (Amsterdam is packed with fast-food outlets). They are located next to the Vondelpark. I noticed that the locals come here for their relaxation (I wish I had brought my inline skates). The staff are friendly and very helpful. They really do their best to give personal service. So they told me where to safly park my car â‚¬6,- a day!). And they know where you can eat healthy and delicious, without ending up at a restaurant that is promoted in one of the tourist guides. We noticed that the staff and the owner did a lot of effort to make our stay as pleasant as possible. It made my stay a very pleasurable. In brief: - near the park - good value - quiet, clean, comfortable - personal attention, helpful - no smoking in the entire building We had free internet and breakfast was included in the roomrate. Margo

Reviews.Title: “Every bit as good as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: saffstar
Reviews.Content: It's lovely to find out that a place is just as good as it's cracked up to be! Hotel Zandbergen is fabulous, the staff are wonderful - friendly and helpful without being overbearing, they gave us great tips on getting around, eating places and where to celebrate the New Year. We had the quad room which was exceptionally clean. There was a large flat-screen tv which showed BBC2 (handy when we got in at night to wind down to) and patio doors leading to a terrace with table and chairs. The only slight negative is that two of the four beds were very soft; this was fine for me but woudln't be much fun if you need a firm mattress. Breakfast was an excellent continental selection - delicious ham and cheeses, pastries, cereal and hot boiled eggs. Great coffee too and a huge range of teas. The hotel has two tram stops within a couple of minutes walk (both for the No 2 tram). This will take you right the way up to Central Station. If you don't have too much luggage, I'd advise getting the train from the airport to Central Station (3.60 Euro) then buying a public transport pass from there for the duration of your stay (these work out really good value) then hop on the Number 2 tram to Cornelis Schuytstraat - get off and you'll see the 'Hotel' sign outside Zandbergen 30 secs walk ahead of you. We used the trams constantly throughout our stay - for a group of Brits used to expensive, unreliable public transport they were a breath of fresh air! Just another point, before our trip I checked the (very rare) negative reviews of this hotel. One of them stated that the Zandbergen was not close to the Vondelpark - I think the reviewer must have taken a wrong turn! As you come out of the hotel, walk left for 1-2 minutes to the tram stop at Emma Straat, cross the road and you're in the park. We're hoping to return to Amsterdam in the Summer, Hotel Zandbergen will be our first choice for accomodation

Reviews.Title: “The best service I could ever have hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: ManyMiles0809
Reviews.Content: 6 continents and 43 countries...I know hotels and this hotel provided the best service I have ever received in my entire life. The rooms itself are European and typical of what one would expect but the service and value far surpass anything I have ever experienced. I was greeted warmly by name by the owner, Henke, and provided prompt attention and service by his staff. After my first night, I started to realize there would be a mess in trying to fly out of Schipol and I was indeed was caught in the recent traveling chaos in Europe that also affected Amsterdam. So, you can imagine the traumatic experience I could have had but Henke and his hotel helped to make the time of being stranded bearable and almost enjoyable. He held my room that night and rather than increase the rate due to the limited availability of rooms in the area, he decreased the rate and checked on me daily to ensure that I would not forced to spend any night of my three at the airport on a cot. So, surviving this ordeal, I have nothing but warm regards and no complaints whatsoever regarding my stay at Hotel Zandbergen and I now an so thankful to consider Henke a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a short stay. Good value for money. Compact rooms but great service. Steep stairs!”
Reviews.Author: ruthp73
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in November and were really impressed. Great value for money and we would definitely stay again if we were in Amsterdam. The greeting was friendly and helpful; the room was clean, warm and comfortable and the breakfast was tasty and plentiful. The room was a little on the small side, but I think that is the norm in Amersterdam and it certainly didn't detract for us. The bathroom on the other hand was really quite spacious! The hotel is a little way out of the centre, but easily in walking distance (10 mins ish to the Leidesplein) if you are used to walking and it is on the tram line if you are not. The only point to note is that the rooms are accessed by a fairly steep staircase, so not one for people who have difficulty with stairs. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: MichelleO9453
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super clear, nice and great for the price. Very accamodating. It was right next to the tram stop so you could get anywhere in the city easily. only advice I would give is get a day pass for the tram. It will most likely save you money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cosy, clean family style hotel of great value near city center”
Reviews.Author: aris_derksen
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for American size bedrooms in Europe, Amsterdam is defintely not the place to be. Old buildings make small rooms here. But Zandbergen has a choice. You pay a little more for a family room and the smaller single rooms are clean, quiet, economically priced and have all you need for a great night sleep: excellent bed with duvet, shower and bath, garden views and flat screen T.V.: It's clean cosy and of great value for money. All prices include breakfast. Line 2 of the electric tram brings you in exactly 7 minuts into the heart of the city: Leidschenplein. The hotel is on walking distance to the National museum and Van Gogh.The hotel has got bikes available for anyone daring the local traffic on iron horse. So for me it's the best place to be while visiting Amsterdam once a month for business. There is even local parking availble. Thumbs up for Henk DeLugt and his friendly team.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hospitality, fantastic location, fantastic city - Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: polkadot_shade
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were greeted with coffee and chocolates - very much appreciated, thanks Henk! Make sure you buy your canal / harbour tour and museum tickets from the hotel to take advantage of preferential rates. Walk through Vondel Park to absorb the city culture and to reach the tourist attractions. Hotel Zandbergen is approximately 20 minutes stroll through the park to the canal cruises / Hard Rock Cafe / Guinness Bar. Alternatively catch the number 2 tram to Central Station, approximately 10 minutes. Public transport is fantastic, we loved the swipe on, swipe off ticket system. The journey from and to the airport took no longer than 30 minutes via tram and bus, and that was the Sunday service. Breakfast was very good with plenty to chose from. Room (we had number 9) was clean and very quiet at night. As per previous reviews, the stairs are steep and there is no lift but we didn't find this to be a problem. We would definitely recommend Hotel Zandbergen and look forward to staying there should we be lucky enough to visit Amsterdam again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jaybee36
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here with our extended family for the Marathon weekend. Really cant fault the hospitality extended to us. A refreshing change these days ! Welcomed with a cup of coffee whilst we checked in. Rooms clean, yes steep stairs, but think this is par for the course with properties in Amsterdam from what we saw ! Easy access to the tram into the city. Bikes available from the hotel for hire. Free wifi and computer in the lobby. Would we come back ? Yes !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay. Great hospitality. Loved our room”
Reviews.Author: Pattydd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights and 5 days. We had a superior room with a beautiful deck overlooking the back garden. The location really worked for us, as we spent a great deal of time in the museum quarter. Our only negative was that the towels were not changed, We could have asked but just let it go. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Quaint bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AirLib
Reviews.Content: The owner upgraded us from the Quadruple to the Penthouse and no extra cost. It was a great way to start off the trip. The room was huge and convenient located to a grocery store to get various supplies. The location is in the museum district (not around the DAM area) but since we went to the van gogh museum it was very convenient. Also, the tram stop was less then a block away so you are 10-15 mins from the DAM area at all times. Also, surround by some nice local restaurants. The bad news is no elevator. And the penthouse is up 3 flights of stairs. The hotel staff does help with your bags. But the stairs become tricky after a night out on the town. And if you stay the penthouse is way worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: FrankM071
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Zandbergen for a week during which I had work on a cultural project in the neighbourhood. I was positively surprised by the warm welcome and service offered by owner Henk and his staff. I arrived late, but a friendly Henk opened the door and showed me my room. The next morning I was welcomed by, again, Henk who served the breakfast and was genuinly interested in my and other guests' plans for the day. I had a one-person room that was rather small. It fitted is the best subscription one can give, but others might get a bit claustrophobic. The hotel however offers a small lobby that can be used and most guests will be out and about Amsterdam and only use the room for sleeping. The same goes for the bathroom: small is the most positive way to describe it, but it suits the needs. The room was cleaned on a daily basis and I had none of the problems others describe here. Every evening I got back in a neat room with a made bed - nothing to complain. The hotel has free WiFi but I had some problems using it, but succeeded (now I am an ICT guy, so perhaps others have more difficulties). The breakfast is in buffet form and offers a variety of choices. Again: nothing to complain. All in all I can only agree with the positive reviews here and wonder about the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the high rating”
Reviews.Author: eddieandsons
Reviews.Content: We booked 14 hotels (three to five star) through Tripadvisor on our recent trip six week trip to Europe. All met or exceeded expectations based on the reviews, except Hotel Zandbergen. We had an upgraded room. The staff were very helpful, the location great, the bed comfortable and the breakfast OK. However, the sheets had dubious stains, the bathroom stunk, the shower curtain was filthy with mildew, the cupboards were dirty and the whole suite was very tired. At the other end of the spectrum, our friends had a room you couldn't move in, although most other rooms looked a bit bigger - they could not have been smaller! Very disappointing, given its very high rating - put a zero on the end of the rating and it would be about where it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but very small room”
Reviews.Author: yassu
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Zandbergen with a friend having chosen it from the previous reviews. Because of the high rating, we were disappointed and felt the hotel was overpriced. Our room was very small and quite claustrophobic. The twin beds were so close together that only 1 person could walk between them. The furniture was very basic and there was no mirror in the bedroom. The bath was so small that I could get my shoulders, knees or feet in, but not all 3 together! The stairs to the bedrooms are very steep and older guests would certinly struggle. The breakfast room at the Zandbergen is bright but also small - it would not hold all guests at once! Breakfast is laid out on a 'sideboard' where space is limited. There is a reasonable choice of juice, fruit, cereals, bread and rolls, with ham and a couple of cheeses. It was perfectly acceptable but nothing special. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful, quickly sorting out any problems. There are some good, expensive, local restaurants and a lovely brown cafe/pub. It is 10 mins walk to the museums and the canal stop but too far to walk to the centre. The tram is close but at 2 euros 60 for a single journey, this is not cheap. Overall, a nice enough hotel if you don't mind a tiny room, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best location !!”
Reviews.Author: aridah1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment next door to the hotel. 2 storey for four of us, had LOTS of room and was clean. It had character & breakfast was lovely. Would recommend for sure. Service from Hanc (sorry if I splet his name wrong) was GREAT! So close to city and only a 1 min walk to the tram stop that ran on a regular basis. Was only about 40 mins from the airport. After a 30hr flight to get there, the hotel felt som homey, it was great!..Also, was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly OK at its price”
Reviews.Author: anirban4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently...overall it was an okay experience...let me first talk about the better aspects...location is good close to van gogh museum...room was clean...breakfast wasn't bad...now the negative side...bad stairs very old and dangerous especially if you have small kids...for a hotel if its kind price was high...staff were average...in short i would say look at other options and if you can't get anything else that's better then stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: davidbriggs
Reviews.Content: From the professional and genuine welcome on day one to our departure the attention to detail and desire to provide a comfortable and respectful service shone through.....clean, comfortable, located in an interesting district within striding distance of some great sites this hotel delivered beyond our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent penthouse for the family!”
Reviews.Author: mike_at_los_altos_CA
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the penthouse in Hotel Zandbergen. The penthouse has a family+living room, dining area, kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, and a balcony. We didn't really use the kitchen since we didn't cook at all. We (the parents) stayed in the bedroom while the kids slept on the sofa bed in the living room. I think that the family room sofa can be converted to a sofa bed also, but I am not sure. The hotel has free Internet via wifi. When we arrived, the sofa bed was already set up. Thanks. The penthouse was very very very clean. We were happy with the set up and had no problem at all. Service: Breakfast was great. The usual drinks, bread&toast, eggs, cheese, cold cuts and salmon were available. They gave us excellent directions for sightseeing. They also did one basket of laundry for us for 7.5 Euros. I especially appreciated that they promise to finish the laundry on the same day before we leave for Prague. So we just dropped off the laundry with them around breakfast time, then checked out of the hotel, left the luggage with them, and come back later to pick up the luggage and laundry before heading to the train station. Couple minor things ... 1) The hotel was not in the main drag of Amsterdam but still very accessible. It is very close to the museums. But if you are interested in the train station + red light district area, then it is a bit out. I, personally, love the location. 2) The bedroom of the penthouse is facing the main street. I had no problem with street noise but one night some people were out in a nearby pub and were a bit noisy. Overall, we really liked the hotel, its service and its location. We would definitely recommend the hotel to others and go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Has its pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: jhdpaqu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 children (8, 11) stayed at Hotel Zandbergen for 4 nights. We had the quad room, which is on the first level of the hotel (below the lobby). Our room was much bigger than we expected and contained 4 single, comfortable beds. It was very spacious by European standards and had a nice flat screen TV, which actually had some chanels in English the kids could watch at night. There was a sliding door and patio off the room, which was shared with the room next door. The breakfast was nice, however the assortment was not good as some of the other hotels we stayed at during the trip. The hotel was very close to the tram stop and we were able to walk easily to Van Gogh and Vondlepark. The owner was also genuinely friendly and very helpful with planning the day and recommending places to eat with the kids. He also did not charge us for the mini bar items we used (which were very reasonably priced) and said "they were on the house". Never heard that before! The lobby had a computer with free internet access. This was great for quick look ups, checking email and ticket purchasing. These are the pros. The only negatives I would have are that this room (and 2 others) are directly below the lobby. Which means that in the morning, you hear footsteps from 7 am onward (breakfast area above) and also on a few nights where we turned in before 9 pm with the kids, we could hear everyone coming home for the night. Most of this was resolved by asking for a fan to block out some of the sound. The only other con was the bathroom. It was beautiful and looked to be completely re-done very recently.....but for some reason had black mold on the ceiling and wall tiles in some places. I couldn't figure why they would have a nice brand new bathroom and not bother to clean this? Also the white cloth shower curtain was too long for the tub and hence was soaking wet after each shower.
