The bottom 12 inches was yellow and smelled very musty from not drying properly. I didn't want to touch it. Again, very easily resolved if given the time. The towels seemed old/thin. Bathroom items, such as soap/shampoo/faceclothes, were not replaced when empty on several occassions. I think the price we paid was a little steep, but overall I would recommend it as a good place to stay for a few nights. If I came back, I might check out a few other hotel before deciding.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, superb service!”
Reviews.Author: George_Cantstanza
Reviews.Content: As many other tripadvisor reviewers have mentioned, Henk (the owner manager) does everything he can to make sure you have a pleasant stay, assisted by his very pleasant staff. The rooms are spotless, have a minibar (but no room safe), bathrooms small but immaculate, you get free wifi (plus a computer in reception for your use), a good breakfast, hire of decent bikes for 10 euros a day (much more convenient than hire shops), all parts of the hotel are well looked after.... Henk has a good eye for detail and makes sure everything is spot on. The hotel is near an entrance to vondelpark, a few minutes walk to the museumplein or ledseplein, a 15 minute tram journey to central station. My only gripe : although the hotel is on a quiet street with little traffic, if you have a room facing the street then any traffic noise from the street seems to be accoustically amplified and in the room it's much noisier than it should be, even with the windows closed. I believe it's only the single rooms which are affected as the other rooms overlook the quiet little garden at the back, but you might want to check with the hotel before reserving a room (to make sure it's not facing the street) if this noise is likely to bother you. Nevertheless, I give the hotel an excellent rating, because so much else about the hotel, especially the service, is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best Amsterdam stay in 40 years”
Reviews.Author: MargaretEllen1950
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth or fifth visit to Amsterdam and I was not looking forward to the hotel stay as I had never found a good one. That has ended with the great stay at the Hotel Zandbergen. Spiffy modern bathroom, comfortable and clean bedroom looking to a beautiful interior courtyard. Heavenly croissants baked right there. Delicious breafast served in the cheery breakfast area. Charming host. Right on the tram line to get anywhere or a doable walk to the museums. This hotel made all the difference to my perception of this city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location; great room; full breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Janet-with-kids
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised with this B&B in Amsterdam. From the beginning with their email inquiring about our arrival, they were attentive and friendly. The hotel's location is ideal - it's far enough removed from the obnoxious and tourist trap places but close enough and easy enough to hop on the #2 tram which takes you less than a block away from the hotel. The breakfast was full and hearty with a nice assortment. The only drawback for some people might be the stairs to navigate as they are steep, but their staff is more than willing to lift your bags up if you need the help; you just need to be able to navigate the stairway on your own. I would definitely return to this hotel when I return to this city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience with Children”
Reviews.Author: Dubitoff
Reviews.Content: Sometimes a place exceeds your expectations in every way. The Hotel Zandbergen does that at every turn. Yes it's spotless, yes the rooms are bigger than expected. The bathrooms are well equipped, the towels big and plentiful. The breakfast is terrific and the staff fantastic. But it's not the sum of its parts that makes the Zandbergen so great. It's the total experience. At breakfast when Henk (the owner) makes your coffee and asks you about your plans for the day, he's not being polite, he's looking for ways to help. Ways to avoid the lines at the Van Gogh? Henk's got it covered. Children visiting the Nemo? Henk tells you to have lunch next door at the terrace on the top floor of the Amsterdam Library (incredible food, views and value). My wife thought he may have had Swiss hotel training and bought this after a decade or so with a top flight organization. I never remembered to ask him. Yes the hotel is great but what makes it special is that Henk and his staff makes it the very core of an Amsterdam visit. It's comfortable, quiet and clean but it's also effortless. I'd much rather stay here than the more prestigious hotels in town (I refuse to call them better). I've stayed in some of them. They're fine but none of the warmth and uniqueness of the Zandbergen. The hotel is really, really easy to get to. Tram 2 from the city centerâ€“about 15 minutes. It's a great neighborhood; the Vondelpark is across the street. There are fine restaurants and services within a block or two but it's easy to get to the center for more. The only issue for older folks are the stairs. Amsterdam stairs are always steep and narrow. And there's no elevator here but the staff will help you and there are ground floor rooms. We actually stayed in two places while there, both the penthouse (a real treat and very big by any standard) and the basement family room. We also got a look at a small double next door. They're all great and all a bit bigger than what you get in most of Amsterdam. Oh and the price for doing your laundry is a great value. The Lonely Planet Amsterdam City Guide says that the Zandbergen "stands out like sterling silver in a tray of plastic cutlery." I couldn't agree more. Obviously, we loved this place and would be utterly befuddled with what to do if it weren't available on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Host”
Reviews.Author: karentoby
Reviews.Content: Hank is the perfect host. Upon awakening he had coffee ready for me, and soon after a lovely breakfast with some lovely classical music in the background. He kindly and patiently helped me change my train reservations by calling the operator himself and doing most of the legwork for me. He is an elegant host. The hotel was in a perfect location away from the main part of town; it is quiet in this neighborhood as was my room where I slept with an open window by my head. It is adjacent to a most beautiful park where I strolled early in the morning. If I ever returned to Amsterdam I would return to this hotel not only for its amenities but to once again see Hank.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, neat and good service”
Reviews.Author: baculaat
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Simple, but clean rooms. Bathroom somewhat small, but clean. Good breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff. I did not like the location that much, it was about a 15 minute walk to the centre. No lift.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Amsterdam--Even with Kids!”
Reviews.Author: anes1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Zandbergen several times in the past, and will continue to return here when we visit Amsterdam (with our 4 and 6 year old daughters). It is located in a quiet and posh neighbourhood, with plenty of very good cafes and brasseries close by, including fine organic grocery store and bakery. The owner is a true host: very helpful, well-organized, and keen to help with all requests (even offering special breakfast foods for our girls). They sell tickets to the excellent Van Gough Museum (10-min walk or short tram ride), so no waiting in queues is required! The no.2 tram stops just outside, so getting the city-centre is just so easy--this also means that this hotel is quieter and more relaxed than those on the canals. Concertgebouw is also very close by. Yes, the steps inside are very steep (this is Amsterdam) but the rooms are bright, spotlessly clean and carefully prepared. Ours had plenty of space for the four of us. The prices are also v. good value, esp. with reliable service and helpfulness, free wi-fi and computer with printer for all guests to use. We will return again!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Porticoworld
Reviews.Content: Landed in Amsterdam with no preliminary bookings or study on the area.... time got away from me. Spent a couple of hours in internet cafe looking for hotel while the locals smoked their time away. After much deliberation, the choice was outstanding. Henk and his team make you feel welcomed and are caring and considerate. Situate around twenty mins work to the cbd , trams run right past front door and there is a huge park just two mins away. The hotel is exceptional in its cleanliness, warm and personal with its service and not huge rooms but very very comfortable.....and they even did my washing...... i will be staying here each time i visit in future whilst Henk rules the roost.... no hesitation in recommedning them.

Reviews.Title: “In a perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: newmurphy
Reviews.Content: Even though our trip was postponed for 10 days and we had to cancel our original reservation, I was fortunate to still be able to book at the Hotel Zandbergen for four days in early May. This hotel is located in a perfect location if you want to be away from the noise of the main part of Amsterdam, but be an easy tram ride from the main sites. To catch Tram #2 which is a main tram line in Amsterdam, you have to walk 1/2 block. The Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum are 2 and 3 tram stops away, respectively and Centraal Station takes 15-20 minutes to get there. Yes, this hotel has steep narrow stairs, so if you have difficulty climbing stairs, you may think twice about this hotel--there is no elevator. However, your luggage is conveniently carried up to your room for you. Breakfast served is very adequate to start your day. There is a selection of cereal, fruit and delicious croissants with jam, coffee, tea and orange juice. The owner, Henk, is a wonderful host and will gladly answer all your questions, plus provide suggestions for sightseeing not only in Amsterdam, but for daytrips also. I have to make this comment...My sister and I had a twin room that was more than adequate for the two of us. The bathroom was also adequate--and the bathtub did have a shower curtain. As far as my fellow travelers commenting on the size of European hotels rooms, I have to say what do you expect??? First of all, you are in Europe on vacation. How much time are you really spending in your room? I want a room to sleep and take a shower, period. I don't spend thousands of Euros to spend alot of time in my hotel room. Secondly, you are in Europe. Buildings are much older and usually smaller. Third, Hotel Zandbergen is located in a narrow canal house--what exactly were you expecting? I have travelled several times to Europe and it simply amazes me how many people complain about the size of their hotel rooms. If you are judging a hotel by the size of the rooms, perhaps you should book at the dreary, uninspiring large chain hotels next time. Oh well, off of my soapbox. I found Hotel Zandbergen charming and would definitely stay there if I'm ever back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A little bitty slot of a room”
Reviews.Author: 10fish
Reviews.Content: An utterly serviceable room but definitely small. There was room for a bed and a tiny desk and chair and a narrow wardrobe. The shower, toilet, and sink were cozy in the little bathroom (no curtain or anything around the shower). My window opened onto the street, and I opened it to cool the room off. There was traffic noise but very little sound from passersby. The room was clean, but there were spots on the carpet and scuff marks on the walls. I think is not the kind of room that's great for hanging out, but I spent little time there during my one night stay. All in all, it was a good experience. The service was just excellent, with kind, caring people. I was delighted that Henk cheerfully carried by small luggage down the crazy steep stairs as I was leaving. I liked the variety at breakfast and was very happy for the first egg of my trip. And the free internet access was a fine bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a gem”
Reviews.Author: awksmk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Zandbergen is a fine little hotel. Not recomened for those who have problems with stairs which are steep and narrow. Also while the rooms are re quite comfortable and very cleam, ours was small with little storage space. Other wise we would heartily rcommend the Zanderberg.

Reviews.Title: “I spent a lovely week in Amsterdam in...”
Reviews.Author: DukeWanderer
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely week in Amsterdam in mid-May in one of the Apartments at this hotel. Henk was an excellent and gracious host, the staff was very friendly and the breakfast was excellent. I enjoyed the location near the park and there were several good restaurants near the hotel. I followed Henk's advice and took a bus to Voldendam, picked up a bike/lunch and rode 20km along the coast to Marken. Several nice towns along the way, a windmill, cheese farm, and lovely views. Took the ferry back to voldendam all in one afternoon. There is no place else I will stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the Strong of Limb”
Reviews.Author: ironmanstamford
Reviews.Content: A nice, small (14 rooms) hotel on a trolley line near Vondel Park and the major museums. Very nice and hospitable owner fusses over his guests...a true jewel for travelers. The cold breakfast is modest but adequate. But, and its a big but for some of us (that's but, not butt) the stairs, oh, the stairs: long, steep and narrow. And all the way to the top floor where we occupied the huge penthouse apartment, complete with kitchen and terrace. The but is: no elevator! It was quite a hike up and down four times a day. A lovely place to stay if you're a triathloner, but not if you're not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: 2cool4theroom
Reviews.Content: The Zandbergen is in a great neighborhood just outside of the main tourist area with lots of good restaurants, bars and shopping close by. You can walk through Vondelpark and be at the Leidesplein in a few minutes. From there you can easily walk practically anywhere in Amsterdam. Our room had a balcony overlooking a small park. The breakfast was very good. Henk and his staff are very friendly and helpful but not at all intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, extremely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: caribbeanlovers10
Reviews.Content: We've traveled through Amsterdam over 50 times in the 15 years for both business and pleasure (like Queen's Day). In a city of where even the biggest name hotels are heavily worn, and marginal, Zandbergen stands out one that's trying to change this image. The hotel is charming, clean, with extremely helpful staff, and an owner Henk, who is personally involved with every guest. It's just off the main tourist area so you're not kept up all night yet, it's four trams stops on the 2 line (15-20 minutes walk) back to Leidesplein Square and the beginning of the 'party zone,' if you're looking for that. Famous museums and concert halls are just down the street. The hotel is well maintained with smaller comfortable rooms that are just fine for any tourist activity or staying on business when you're out all day anyway. No elevator but the staff will carry your bags and will not accept a tip! Breakfast was simple (by European terms, spectacular when compared to a Country Suites Inn) but plenty, and if anything ran out, it was promptly replaced. Can't beat the value anywhere else in the area. I'm afraid to post a good rating as it may make it harder for me to make my next reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B/hotel with a wonderful owner!”
Reviews.Author: kitkatbreak
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stopped over Amsterdam for one night during the crazy Iceland Volcano week in April 2010. We had difficulty getting out of AMS/Schiphol airport because we had no Euros and our American credit cards wouldn't work because it didn't have the "special chip" (and there were no signs stating this). After 2 hours, we were finally able to get out of the airport by train and head into the city. We tried to enjoy ourselves despite the bad weather and the dirtiness of Amsterdam Centraal area. After walking for hours visiting sites and looking at architecture, we finally took the tram #2 around 10pm to Hotel Zandbergen. We were very nervous because it seemed so out of the way from the Centraal area. The tram went through the center of town for a good 15-20 mins and we walked out to a completely quiet, pleasant, seemingly deserted part of town next to Vondelpark. Exhausted and cold, we walked a few steps to the hotel and what a pleasant surprise. The door opened automatically and Henk, the proprietor, greeted us with a very warm smile, pleasant greetings and offered us a hot cup of coffee or tea. He carried the tray up the stairs and showed us our room, #17. I was glad we didn't have our luggage with us since there was no lift/elevator (like most of Amsterdam). The room was fairly open and large with a couch, a desk, two twin beds, a 27" flatscreen TV mounted in front of the beds, mini-bar and two closets. The bathroom was small but well appointed. The window was large and when we opened it the next day, it opened to the view of a small, quaint garden in the back with a small terrace and beautiful flowering trees and evergreens. The continental breakfast was nice and the eating area was quite cute. The hotel offers free wifi and had a computer station in the lobby. I saw various travel guidebooks and reading materials in the common area as well. During breakfast, Henk gave us advice on the museums (which are walking distance) and a free concert during lunch time. He was knowledgeable and offered many good local tips. The hotel has tickets to the nearby museums so you don't have to reserve ahead and would be able to skip the lines. (Please confirm this with Henk ahead of time since this may change.) My friend and I already bought the IAMsterdam card so we had access to the museums and free transport already. We still had to wait on a fairly long line at the Van Gogh Museum with the IAMsterdam card. Since Centraal area hotels/b&b/hostels are either too expensive or dirty, I would highly recommend Hotel Zandbergen. The location is not bad at all--especially since couple of trams and buses go there. We could have taken a bus directly to Hotel Zandbergen from the airport instead of taking the train to Centraal station since the hotel is located half way between the airport and Centraal station. This is cheaper and may be a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant place with a great proprietor”
Reviews.Author: francine_r
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my partner on a short break to Amsterdam. We had a good stay - the proprietor was really welcoming and helpful, breakfast delicious, and the rooms comfortable and well thought out (e.g. English-language glossy magazines left to read).

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable B+B with a Delightful Host !”
Reviews.Author: graceson
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zandbergen was a wonderful surprise to this weary traveler. Having arrived on the red-eye from Memphis, my luggage was carried up the 2 flights of narrow, typically Dutch stairs for me. My single room was spotlessly clean and comfortable with a bathroom and shower. Cleansing gel and lotion along with a hairdryer were provided. A small room refrigerator was also stocked with wine, water, beer and a few snacks. The room was well thought out with regards to space, there was not an over abundance of unusable space. Everything one would need was right there perfectly placed. Downstairs in the public area was a delight with Henk my host graciously offering coffee and suggestions as to how to handle the jet-lag. They all worked!! Breakfast the next morning was delicious with something for every taste. The computer was put to good use as was the free Wi- Fi. Henk helped with directions and suggestions for the best use of my time in seeing what I wanted to see. There are some wonderful little restaurants and cafes in that area of Amsterdam. Just walk down the street in any direction. Look out for the people on bicycles.....they aren't looking out for you!!! When plans necessitated a one night stay back in Amsterdam before flying home a week later, I again booked the Zandbergen and was upgraded to a larger room with no stairs for my, by then, battered knee. Such a kind gesture from my new friend Henk and the rest of the staff at this hidden gem of a B+B. Dutch Hospitality at it's best!! There are people of all nationalities staying at this B+B. One does not feel surrounded by americans, instead the opportunity exists to meet many interesting people and learn something new. As a single woman traveling alone, I felt quite safe there and cared for. A nice thing to be able to say in these days and times.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean hotel with Great beds and new linen”
Reviews.Author: Yarrockster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and found the hotel to be the best value for money. We booked direct with the hotel website the night before and picked it up for half price! We did a PO Ferries cruise staying an additional night and also picked that up for half price too through their website! Anyway, the hotel is on the tram route, (get an all day ticket so you can hop on and off.)Impeccably clean and all faclities were uptodate and working. Brilliant breakfast , free internet, nice staff, quiet location, good english, what more could you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: ml77
Reviews.Content: Pros: - nice, modern, clean bedroom and bathroom - quiet location in a lovely area, close to major museums - free usage of computer - breakfast - great value Cons: - we liked the location (especially for summer) but I guess some people would like to be "closer to the action" - steep stairs: this did not bother us, it's actually part of the charm but it could be an issue for other travelers (elderly for instance) We would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL RELAXING ZANDBERGEN, AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: FRUITGUM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend and thought the hotel and staff were wonderful. We had a back bedroom and although small, the room was fabulously clean and a good sized bathroom. We had two beds pushed together, a good sized dressing table, a T.V. and huge wardrobe. The room was up two flights of extremely steep stairs as this is a canal house, which added to its charm but we just managed with two carry on cases. The tram is 50 meters down the road and a good tip is to buy the I AMsterdam card (EURO 58 or EURO 52 per person for 3 days, if you buy on line). We deliberated about this, but worked out we saved about EURO 250 altogether, expecially if you need a tram to your hotel every day. This price included every museum, tram and bus and also a free 1.5 hour canal cruise. The only two things we paid for, was Anne Franks house and the hop on hop off bus. The breakfast at the hotel was plentiful for a continental breakfast and replenished all the time. You can buy a bottle of wine for EURO 9.95 from the reception (with free Pringles!!) which was less than half the price we were paying in restaurants and pubs. There are two local Tapas bars but one is extrememely expensive and one excellent. The excellent one from the hotel - turn right , take the first right (past a restaurant called Spring), cross over the road and take the first left. The Tapas bar is on your right. We found it much cheaper to eat in the centre of town. A good restaraunt is on Spui and called Rancho (an Argentinian). They do a tourist menu for EURO 8.85 (when you are there, you will realise how cheap this is!!) with steak to die for. We went a few times. If you get the I AMsterdam card, they give you a voucher for a EURO 22.99 meal for EURO 16.95 but the tourist menu is as good. Nothing is too much trouble for the hotel staff. They will advise you where to go and when, sell cheaper tickets for the attractions and make fabulous coffee when you return freezing cold. (Dropped to minus 6 last week). We had a fabulous 4 days and can't wait to do it again. The only negative points for us personally were - Hermitage Museum is shut until 5th March 2010, The Rijks Museum is being renovated and only showing a small amount of art (1 hour to get around) and there are two rooms in the Anne Frank House being renovated at the moment. Check with all these on line before you go. Another lovely idea is the Candlelight cruise in the evening. Cheese and wine and a courier pointing out the sights. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitaltiy, clean, great location.”
Reviews.Author: cradsie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. For a mid-range budget there is no where else I would stay in Amsterdam. It is right on the number 2 tram straight into the centre in about 12 minutes. Van Gogh museum is 2 stops away. The area has some wonderful brasseries. We had a small apartment, which was great. The rooms are cleaned each day. Breakfast was plentiful buffet of bread, cheeses, hams, cereals, fresh juices, coffee, tea, fruit, yoghurt, boiled eggs etc. The service was excellent with nothing too much trouble. I would stay here again without hesitation. My other two friends said the same, in fact we are planning our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: MiKaKiev
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located hotel 10 min from the noisy center. Nice staff and service. Perfectly working Wi-Fi. Great small restaurants and cafes around. Very "dutch" cheese store just around the corner. Plumbing needs some work â€“ I had permanent smell from the bathroom drain pipes (3rd floor). In general â€“ very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cringo
Reviews.Content: The room was small and no frills. It was cleaned each day and fresh towels were supplied each day. Had a room facing the street and had no problem with noise. In fact, the neighborhood is quiet and safe as well as accessible to the city center -- walk or tram. The service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LondonRhino
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Zandbergen for 3 nights in November 2009 and as we chose this hotel based on excellent reviews on this site and feel they are somewhat generous - felt it necessary to write a review. The room was clean but very basic and like someone else mentioned - very plain and like a dorm room. We had a street facing room and the noise from outside was consistently audible. The beds and pillows were very saggy and uncomfortable and even though we requested a double bed (was confirmed by email) we had two single beds pushed together. The bathrooms towels were very well worn and almost threadbare - they were not changed during our entire stay. The blankets and duvets weren't changed either and the room was only cleaned once. The shower in the bathroom was nothing more than a glorified garden hose and the fitting on the wall was loose meaning that if the hose wasn't lodged firmly in place it would spring free sending water all over the bathroom. The breakfast "buffet" consisted a choice of croissants, rolls, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, 2 types of cereal, 3 types of fruits, 2 fruit juices with tea or coffee. When it was finished it wasn't replenished. On the plus side the manager was very friendly and helpful, the hotel is in a good neighbourhood, is close to Vondel Park, restaurants. museums and the tram number 2 (to central station) stops very close to the hotel. I know this comes off as a very negative review but when paying â‚¬140 a night I would have expected a lot more from this hotel and would suggest people try somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: marcansue
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at Hotel Zandbergen. It is located near tram stops, restaurants and is a short walk (10 minutes) to museums and the center (15 minutes) of Amsterdam in a quiet, beautiful neighborhood near Vondel Park. We arrived at 7:00 AM to drop off our bags after an overnight flight. Henk, the owner greeted us and rushed to make a room ready so that we could rest and freshen up. He upgraded us to a spacious apartment in the next door annex. The room was clean, bright and comfortable. Henk is a gracious innkeeper that works hard to make sure his guests enjoy their stay. He will provide you with information about Amsterdam that is accurate and make arrangements. Henk contacted a taxi that provided transportation to the airport at a fair price. He also called to confirm our pick up that morning. Breakfast was included, with great service provided by Henk. We highly recommend this great owner run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1marklinman
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel in the South of Amsterdam for a brief culture- and shopping trip and this hotel looked promissing on Tripadvisor. I can confirm that it is nice indeed. Friendly staff, great breakfast with classical music, clean rooms and a decent bed. We will go back to this hotel for sure! BTW: if you want a room where you can hang out or dine, you may want to look elsewhere: here you only sleep, have breakfast and then enjoy Amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JanDup
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very helpful. Especially the owner Henk who could not do enough to help us. The continental breakfast was a good meal for the day. The hotel is near a tram stop so access to the whole of Amsterdam is particularly easy. The stairs to the second floor were a bit difficult because we are not so young anymore. For a 3 star it is excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for our first trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MarySacramento
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zandbergen is a delightful small hotel in a quiet neighborhood. The staff, especially, Hank, are wonderful. Exploring the city on foot or hopping on the convenient transit system made visiting the great museums and finding terrific restaurants a breeze!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: beki_85
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location for me as I was going to a conference out of the centre. Even so the tram is right outside, was cheap and went directly to the centre in about 15 minutes I think. The area is lovely, and importantly felt safe to walk around in after dark, which can be a worry as a lone female. There looked to be some nice restaurants around the corner, though I didn't eat there. Vondelpark is spitting distance, it was nice - and would have been lovely without the rain! The major highlight though was the staff. On arrival (about 8.30pm) the lady on reception was very efficient, and even took the time to help explain transport for me for the next day, and even carried my bag upstairs for me! The following day Henk (correct me if I have the name wrong!) greeted me at breakfast and gave me the tram ticket and made sure I knew where I was going. As he knew I was going to a conference he even offered the use of the reception's computer as another guest was on the free internet. Every morning he was supremely friendly to all the guests; seemed to be fluent in at least 3 languages and showed a genuine interest in people's day trips and offered very good advice. It was a pleasure to meet someone who honestly seemed to care about the guests on a personal level and I would stay here again if I was to return, depsite the distance to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious penthouse in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in the Museum district on a mostly residential street. For that reason, it is great for sleeping as it is relatively quiet. The hotel is very convenient to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum and well within walking distance of the central canal areas. There are lots of restaurants are close as well as Vondel Park, a green oasis within the city. Three of us stayed in the penthouse. The penthouse is huge by European standards with a bedroom area, a bathroom with shower only, huge living room with a double sofa bed at one end, a terrace, a dining area and a lovely kitchen with large windows on two sides. Some basic food supplies were in the kitchen. Most important was the coffee maker. There is skylight so the penthouse feels very spacious and light when the sun is out. It is at the top of three sets of very steep and narrow steps. There is no elevator so staying in the penthouse gives you a bit of a work out each time you return to the hotel! A breakfast buffet is included with the room and offers a variety of cold breakfast items. The main floor reception area also has a computer available for guests nd wi-fi is also available free of charge throughout the hotel. Best of all, the staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Our daughter had a massive suitcase as she was going to be staying in the Netherlands to go to school. We were very grateful to the two staff who negotiated the huge case up the narrow, steep staircases. We mentioned we wanted to go to the Van Gogh museum and they were able to provide us with tickets which saved us the long queue at the museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: BronaghA
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by this hotel. It's situated in a well-off part of town beside the Vondel Park and a short walk from the main art museums. Our room was small but this was my fault for not confirming that I would be bringing a friend. I think many Amsterdam hotels tend to be small businesses and have small rooms. Anyway, when I complained of the bed being too soft, Henk put a board under the mattress which worked out fine. Very pleasant and friendly owner and staff although not intrusive. I highly recommend - very quiet and safe area with lots of eateries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & quiet stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jesfa
Reviews.Content: We needed somewhere for one night in Amsterdam at the end of a France/Netherlands trip in September 2007. We did a lot of research to find somewhere that fit our requirements: clean, quiet, reasonable price, would accept a one night stay and was still close to Central Station for easy access to the airport train. Zandbergen fit all these needs and more. They served one of the biggest breakfasts we'd encountered during our trip, with a lot of choice. As we were only there one night, our experience is limited, but I wouldn't hesitate to book with them again or to recommend the hotel. Everything was very clean and well taken care of. My only caution is the lack of an elevator for older visitors or people with leg/knee problems. Our room was on the second floor with access only by a narrow staircase which is quite common in Europe, but many North Americans might be shocked by it. We thought the location was great as we wanted somewhere close to, but not in the heart of town, so we could sleep peacefully at night. The tram from Central Station is a short ride and very convenient. We were greeted courteously and had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Agreeable in all respects”
Reviews.Author: graceNewBrunswick
Reviews.Content: Rating "excellent" (misinterpreted the symbol before!) Being September now, I recall green parrots and blossoms of magnolia tree from a private balcony with a spotless and quiet room, conveniently located so that we could take the tram to Central Station area. Ample breakfast began the day. Good memories retained!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it from the moment we walked in”
Reviews.Author: Tallposts
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend in Amsterdam and two nights at the Hotel Zandbergen due to the reviews on this web site for my wife and our two daughters (7 and 11). In the email confirmation I explained we would be arriving early as we were leaving home at 3.00am and asked to store our luggage until check in at 13:00. On arrival we were met by Henk and what a warm welcome we received. He knew where we had travelled from and the fact it was an early start and allowed us to go into the room at 10:30. The accomodation was clean and bright with a great flat screen TV with English channels. The breakfast was plentiful each day and set us all up for a day of exploring. Henk spent a lot of time advising us on tickets and places to visit and how to use the trolley network. He marked up our map and our daughters used his map for the whole visit. His advice to get tickets for the Van Gogh musuem from the hotel was excellent, especially when we got to the museum and saw the line for tickets stretching up the road - thanks Henk. The hotel location is excellent for the museum area and right next to a trolley stop from where you can be at the Central Station in 15 minutes. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and we found a wonderful Italian restuarant one block towards the City with great staff and fantastic food. Hopefully we will return to Amsterdam and when we do we will look to stay at Henk's place. when

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff & delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_in_Montreal
Reviews.Content: I have never before experienced such friendly, attentive service as I did at Hotel Zandbergen. I booked my stay based on the reviews I read here and I was not disappointed. The small rooms and steep stairs were just as described, but I have absolutely no complaints about them. The staff was available to help carry my luggage up the stairs. I was in a single room and it was fine for one person. I think the double rooms are bigger. Everything was spotless. Breakfasts were always fresh. Even though my room faced the street, it was quiet and peaceful there. The tram stop was close by, and it took no time at all to get to the city center. I felt like I had the best of both worlds. I could spend most of my time in middle of it all, but then take a breather in the peaceful neighbourhood by the hotel. There were plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby with patios set on pretty streets. As I mentioned, the service at the hotel was excellent. Henk and his staff recommended places I should visit and helped me figure out how to get around. In general, they were friendly and gracious hosts. I plan to stay there again the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “This is getting to be a habit... another great stay at Hotel Zanbergen”
Reviews.Author: EduardTravels
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in the last four years; the second since Henk purchased the Hotel. Every stay gets better. This time I visited with my teenage nephew. We stayed in room 9 which is a twin. The rooms have been upgraded to have small flat screen televisions and the wireless connectivity has been greatly improved with a router on each floor. Henk took particular care to make sure that my nephew had a wonderful time (THANK YOU!). He helped us efficiently navigate from one side of Amsterdam to the other using the trams and trains and we saw everything we intended. As some other reviews have said, the personal service is amazing. As long as Henk is there (and I hope for a long, long time), I will always stay at Hotel Zandbergen. A very nice touch was a personal email from Henk making sure we arrived home safely. Simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TBO8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the quadruple room at Hotel Zandburgen for two nights. It was clean and adequate for the four of us with a nice patio off the back. While a bit expensive for the caliber of room, there seemed to be few options for a family with children in the city. The staff at the hotel was great, helping us get to know our way around the city, making bookings and suggestions of things to do, and providing a hearty breakfast to start each morning. The location is great as well, in the heart of the city, within walking distance of most major attractions. The hotel also has a computer in the lobby with Internet access that they let us use free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ab2000
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights in this hotel after reading many positive reviews about it here. Indeed all of them were precise. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood that gives a safe feeling walking there. It's located 10 mins walking from Museumplein, but also tram number 2 is very close to the hotel. The hotel staff and the manager Henk are extremely friendly , patient and kind to guests. Perhaps the most friendly hotel staff I have ever seen. The stairs are indeed a bit tough to climb, however Henk is aware of that and helped with the luggage both for checkin and checkout. The room was relatively small, however very clean, and the bathroom looked like recently renovated and was clean as well. The breakfast was basic but good - cornflakes, cheese, bread, fruits, coffee, tea. The hotel has a computer in the lobby, and also free wireless in rooms. The price is a bargain, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel should have a Henk!”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in March for a weekend leisure visit to Amsterdam. The hotel itself is in a quiet suburb of Amsterdam that is very easy to reach by tram from the centre of town. Henk, the owner, gave us a very warm welcome and even offered advice on what to drink to my friend after he had drunk too much alcohol. We each had a single room and the plus side, the free wifi is a real bonus and the flat screen television seemed to have a great choice of channels. You also get a well stocked and reasonably priced mini-bar with the first drink being on the house. The rooms themselves are very small though, barely enough room to spin around (but I didn't see the double rooms so couldn't comment on those - I am just referring to the single rooms). Breakfast was excellent with all the bits you would expect to find in a continental style breakfast. Overall, other than the small rooms, this hotel is excellent and I will return when I am next in Amsterdam. A special note should be made about Henk who is, in all my years of travelling, the best host I have ever met.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: wila
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for 1 night in February. We stayed at this hotel and the reason for my visit was to visit Amsterdam before we caught a flight back to the UK. The Hotel was easy to get to on the Tram from Central Station. Weâ€™d stayed at other hotels in Holland on the previous 2 nights. The price was expensive compared to other parts of Holland. But Amsterdam does appear quite expensive for accomodation. The Hotel staff were really friendly and made you welcome. The hotel and room was very clean and tidy albeit on the small side. If youâ€™re disabled or have difficulty getting up stairs then this place is not for you. There is a spiral staircase which can be a challenge if youâ€™re not fit. The breakfast was good and the choice of food was reasonable. We would recommend the hotel to other people especially as the staff were so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place I've stayed in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nighthawk420
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Zandbergen from 24-2-2009 to 4-3-2009. We had and excellent time, and Henk the owner is a wonderful and gracious host. It has the feel of a 5 star hotel. While we were there we experienced a death in the family, and Henk and his staff bent over backward to ensure that we were still happy. We will be returning in June and plan to stay again. So to anyone who is lookng for a great place to stay, I would highly recommend this hotel. We stayed in the penthouse, which was an amazing place to come back to after a long day. Again I'd like to say that Henk is the best, and was sent to us by an angel. Richard Caron and Virginia Sullivan US

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - family with kids”
Reviews.Author: dafna_adm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Zandbergen for a week end. A family with 3 little children. The hotel is located in a quite area with a tram stop right beside it so very easy to get to the centre. Henk the manager and the staff are very welcoming and helpful. the Kids got all sorts of suprises that really made a difference. We stayed in the Penthouse after we were upgraded from the Apartment we reserved. Excellent big place with enough space for all of us - very unique for a city hotel. big TV screen with Extra DVD movies for you to enjoy. nice kitchen. very comfortable for a familly with kids. also free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small B&B, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: kabeee
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at the Hotel Zandbergen and I must say that for its price, it is money well spent. The location of the hotel is very good, a calmer part of amsterdam, right next to the vondel park, and with a tramstop (tram line 2) at 50m, going directly to the central station passing the centre of the city. The hotel staff adviced me to park the car at the Olympic stadium P+R, and what a very good deal that was! â‚¬15.20 for 3 days and with 2 free tickets for the tram for everyone (max 5 per car). There is also a possibility to have a bike instead of the tram tickets, but unfortunately all the bicycles were gone. Be aware that to get the discount P+R fee of â‚¬6/day, you HAVE to use the tram tickets, else they will charge you at â‚¬2/h We stayed in room 18 which was at the back of the hotel on the 2nd floor, so very quiet. The room had a nice flat-screen, a twin bed with a 2-person mattress. The bathroom has a tiny bath (1m), which can only be used as a shower or for a child, a sink, a toilet and a blowdryer. The staircase is very steep, so getting to the 2nd floor with luggage can be a bit hard, but Henk will help you deal with it. Because it was very cold this weekend, we had some troubles keeping the room at the right temperature. We had turned the heating down too much the first night and since I don't think the windows are fitted with double glass, the temp dropped like hell. Breakfast was ok, everything was fresh, there were some croissants, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, milk, yoghurt, orange juice, coffee, tea, cheese, ham, bread, ... The hotel also sells tickets for some museums, like the Van Gogh, which let you enter the museum without having to queue! So as a conclusion I can say that this hotel is wel worth it's three stars based on its infrastructure, where location and service should give it even a higher rating!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NYHarry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Zandbergen in Amsterdam for 5 days with my wife and 2 children and it was perfect. We stayed in the Penthouse; very roomy, very pleasant, nice furniture and kid friendly. The steep steps getting to the room were not a problem for us but might be if you're past a certain age or size. The hotel was the perfect size between a B&B and a hotel. Breakfast every morning was very nice and the right start to the day. The staff was extremely accommodating. It was all good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Zandbergen”
Reviews.Author: banginout
Reviews.Content: My 29 year old son & I stayed @ the Hotel Zandbergen from November 8-15, 2008. The hotel was very clean. The entire staff was friendly and very helpful. Henk is the managing director, he is totally awesome and will make you feel @ home. Henk is very knowledgable and help you with any questions that you might have about the area. The hotel is near Vondel Park, which is very nice. The #2 trolley runs directly in front of the hotel. You can buy tickets @ the hotel. There are different types of tickets....the staff can explain. The hotel is not located in the heart of Amsterdam, it is more of a residential kind of area. You are near the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseums. The hotel also has a small,but good breakfast. Definately will go back .

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: trish_dadish
Reviews.Content: We were given the four person room, which consisted of 4 seperate beds, and there was plenty of room for the 4 of us. The bathroom was extremely clean, and overall I was impressed with the room. The manager at the front desk was so nice and helpful. We spent a late night out, and he left breakfast out for us a full hour after it ended, and gave us tips on where to eat and have coffee. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good deal in a good location. There are two trams within close walking distance, and the Pjip is a great little neighborhood to explore on top of all the other attractions in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Zandbergen”
Reviews.Author: ARAstudent
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Hotel Zandbergen and loved everything about it: our huge room with kitchen and balcony, the wonderful breakfasts and the friendly and efficient staff. Henk, the manager, is terrific. We walked a lot â€“ the museums, the Concertgebouw and Vondel Park are close -- but we also made much use of the tram, which stops just down the street. We enjoyed staying in a residential neighbourhood where we got an idea of how people live in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: helmil
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by someone on the Amsterdam forum and suited our needs perfectly. The whole property was spotless, the staff friendly and helpful and the breakfast good. It's not located in the centre of town but was right on a tram line, two minutes to Vondelpark and a ten minute walk to the Museum precinct. A few minor things that aren't the fault of the hotel but might put certain groups of travellers off were the steep stairs (to avoid this in Amsterdam you would need to go for a big hotel with lifts) and there is nothing for kids to do. I travelled with a 9yo and we were out all day so it was fine but you would need to bring things for younger kids to play with. Overall though, I would recommend this to anyone and will definitely stay here on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DAISYSydney_Nsw
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Zandbergen. Arriving at night there was no one but a young girl to assist us up two very steep flights of stairs with our luggage. The manager was not around on the two nights that we stayed but was certainly very courteous on the morning we departed. Our bedroom was very small and the fittings overall were quite basic and aged and even though we asked for the faulty phone to be checked, it was never fixed. The ensuite was clean but minimal. I believe that to write a good review on this hotel it would depend on the type and size of the room you stayed in. It was also a distance out of the central area even though it was a short tram ride in. For these reasons I do not understand how it could have been given such a high rating on the website.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bayarddc
Reviews.Content: Well reviewed hotel, worthy of praise. The rooms make remarkably efficient use of very small space. Hotel personnel are uniformly pleasant and helpful. Good breakfast. The Zandbergen sits outside the main tourist area, a short tram ride from Central Station (#2); you can easily walk to the main musea in under 10 minutes. The neighborhood has decent restaurants and the lovely Vondel Park. Downside: very steep stairs, no elevator, so not for those unable to climb. It's not some fabulous wonder in Amsterdam, but it is a fine hotel, reasonably priced, with exceptionally nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel near the pleasant Vondel Park”
Reviews.Author: scoutingfortravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights-Only returned home yesterday! We stayed in a nice double room overlooking the back of the hotel. Room and bed very comfortable and the bathroom looked pretty new-Very clean and tidy. Staff very friendly. Stairs are quite steep so probably not best if your mobility is not 100%. Would recommend this hotel (book a room at the back otherwise you'll be overlooking the busy road).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: George.Quinones
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend 4 nights at Hotel Zandbergen in early May. Henk and his staff were very helpfull and make you feel welcomed. They helped with directions, tram tickets, restaraunts and reservations. The Location is in residential area, 3 stops on the tram to the museums and about 20 minutes to central station on the tram. We stayed in one of the studios, it was clean, roomy, nice clean bathroom, kitchen, a small balcony and a comfortable bed. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would stay there again. We had a great time in Amsterdam! George & Theresa Quinones

Reviews.Title: “not as good as i was expecting”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to finding a new hotel in Amsterdam and the reviews for Hotel Zandbergen looked so good. I have stayed in Amsterdam a few dozen times and have experienced a range of hotels from one star to four stars, so I have a pretty good reference point for this city. I think this property has many different rooms and your experience would be directly proportionate to the nature of your room. Unfortunately, my experience is not reflective of the other reviews and like drslamb I really question the methodology that puts this hotel in the top ten in Amsterdam. The first mistake was mine -- I should have noticed how far the hotel is from the center. While the hotel is just on the #2 tram line, the trams stop at 00.30 (12.30am) so if you stay out late plan to take a taxi or a long walk (I'd say 30 minutes from the Leidseplein). In addition, there is something nice about staying in the canal rings in Amsterdam and this is far from the canal rings. Second, I got an unbelievably small room (and I am used to small rooms) that was facing onto the main road (Willemsparkweg) so I could hear all the traffic and trams. The bathroom was such that the shower was integrated into the bathroom itself so that once you showered the entire floor was covered in water. The toiletries were basically nonexistent except for some shower gel in the wall dispenser. The towels and linens were fine and the bed was comfortable. I had no trouble sleeping -- I kept the window closed to keep out the noise. There was sufficient closet space so I got my luggage out of the way to make more room. The TV was set uncomfortably above the bed and I did not watch much TV. And the wireless internet service worked intermittently and could not be relied upon for business purposes. Now on the positive side, the staff are incredibly helpful and the manager Henk is as charming and courteous as the earlier reviewers have said. The breakfast was typical Dutch breakfast -- meats, cheeses, hard-boiled eggs, breads, rolls + croissant, cereals, coffee, tea, milk, juices -- and Henk made sure the newspaper was sitting on your table. The service was very good. But unfortunately, the location away from the center and the small room could not be corrected by Henk's genuine service. As indicated earlier, it looks like there was some very nice larger rooms (including ones with terraces or gardens that faced away from the road) that are probably worth the extra cost. I'll probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: letoz
Reviews.Content: staying all round the world i rate this hotel as 1 of the best very very friendly but dont repeat dont eat at the PIZZERIA TIVOLI just round the corner it is a very unfriendly overpriced dreadful cafe AVOID

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: drslamb
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but the reviews seem to go a bit overboard. I think that's because the manager (owner?) and the people who work there are all so nice. They bend over backwards to make your stay comfortable and to help you plan your day. The hotel is very pleasant and there was nothing wrong with it... but I find it's rating of 7 out of all hotels in Amsterdam an exaggeration. I would certainly go back and know what I was getting, but I might try something else too. In fact, 12 years ago I stayed at Seven Bridges and I think it was in a lovelier location (near the canals). So here goes with this review -- the room I stayed in was very pleasant and very clean. It was large enough and it had a nice terrace outside. The breakfast in the morning is fine, with hardboiled eggs, cheeses, ham, croissants, cereals, and fruit -- coffee of course. There are phones and TVs in the room. I thought the bathroom was quite large for a small hotel. There is also internet service in the room (free) as well as on the computer in the lobby. The only reason I might stay elsewhere is to be closer to the canals. This hotel is in a safe and lovely neighborhood near Vondelpark. and the museums. The park is great but it's nicer to walk around the canals. This can be done easily enough but you need to take a 15 minute walk first through the park to get to that area. The tram stops right outside of this hotel and it's easy to get anywhere in Amsterdam... so you can take the tram to nicer places to walk. It's also nice to rent a bike, but once again, you have to walk through the park to Leidseplein to rent a bike. You do get the feeling you're a little bit on the outskirts of the city even though it's in the city. All in all, I might stay here again...but I also might go back to Seven Bridges. I think they're comparable but the location makes a different. If you do stay at Hotel Zandbergen, go to the nice tapas restaurant a few blocks away. We thought that was exceptional!... go South to the end of the block, and then take a left and walk 2 or 3 blocks and it's on your left. And if you look for a Reizstafel (rice table) at an INdonesian restaurant -- I think it's better to order separate small dishes than to let them figure out what 12 dishes go together... That's all. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy516
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say that has not already been said by other visitors? I took my Mum on a birthday treat to this great hotel, based on what I had read on Trip Advisor, and was not disappointed. From the moment Henk greeted us with a friendly smile and warm welcome - we felt right at home. Our room was on the ground floor - thank goodness! No stairs to be negociated, apart from the entry set. I recommend asking for this room - room 19 if you have mobility issues and can manage the 6 or 7 steps into the hotel. It was sparklingly clean and was kept clean throughout our visit of 4 nights. It did not feel cramped at all, and the double door cut out all the sound you would anticipate hearing from reception, and the comings and goings of the other guests. I've never had such a good nights sleep in a hotel... ever...! We loved the view of the garden and the wonderful trees you could see in both directions. The position of the hotel was fantastic for visiting Van Gough museum, and the fact that the tram was 1 minute from the hotel was a complete bonus. Henk can sell you the tram passes on reception, which is great, especially on the first day, when everything is new and unknown. He is also a great source of information, as others have pointed out, and even recommended tips on safety and warmth of clothes - which was very welcome, as we would have got it wrong on that day!! Anyway, folks, in summary, lovely service, great breakfast, fab location, a great advert for Dutch hospitality.... just watch out for those mad cyclists, you take your life into your hands crossing roads!! Enjoy... we'll be back... just don't book room 19 when we want to visit :0)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience !!”
Reviews.Author: Fionagus
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two night stay in this outstanding hotel. I booked based on the reviews on trip advisor and they were not wrong. What a find! The rooms, though small, were spotless and very comfortable. The staff were very hospitable, friendly and extremly helpful. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but worth the journey”
Reviews.Author: sundogg99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Zandbergen is a three star property, which means you won't find such amenities as 24 hour room service or a concierge. What you will get at a decent 3 star hotel is a clean, comfortable room with en-suite bath, a daily breakfast, and (in the case of the Zandbergen) a pleasant getaway in the genteel neighborhood adjacent to Vondelpark. We chose the hotel based on its consistently high ratings and reasonable nightly tariff. February is off-season, but Amsterdam is popular year-round for tourists, so rates are not as discounted as in other more seasonal destinations. We got a double room with breakfast for 125 Euro/night. Our flight from North America arrived at Schiphol Airport in the early morning, and we caught the popular Connexxion hotel shuttle service to the hotel, arriving shortly after 9 AM. We'd contacted the hotel previously about our early arrival, and although they couldn't promise us a room, we were encouraged to check in and at least drop off our bags. As it turned out, a room was available for us when we arrived. We enjoyed a fresh croissant and some coffee, after which we took a sorely-needed shower to freshen up after our overnight flight. The Zandbergen occupies two adjacent three-storey buildings, but as is typical of Amsterdam architecture, the buildings are quite narrow. The hotel does not include an elevator and the stairs to the second and third floors are exceptionally steep. Visitors with mobility problems will be challenged to schlep bags from street level to the guest rooms. Once upstairs, don't expect a lot of extra room in your room. Space is at a premium and our hotel room, although adequate in every way, was quite small. The very comfortable double bed took up most of the floor space, with a tiny desk and closet occupying most of the remaining area. The bath was similarly cozy, and included a miniature tub/shower combination, a toilet, sink, and a long shelf on which we could perch our toiletries. Although our room was among the smallest I've ever occupied, the space was well-utilized and everything was of good quality and in fine working order. From our third floor window we gazed across the hotel's rear courtyard area to the yards and windows of adjacent homes. The Zandbergen is located in the Oud Zuid / Museumplein area of Amsterdam. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the Concertgebouw, Rijksmuseum, and Van Gogh museum, and perhaps 15-20 minutes to the Leidseplein area. Vondelpark is just two blocks from the hotel. The neighborhood is a tree-lined mix of shops, upscale restaurants, and gentrified homes. Not nearly as lively as the area closer to the center of town, it is nevertheless a vibrant, non-touristy part of town and a pleasant break from the omnipresent crowds of tourists in the center. Our return flight left very early in the morning and we were unable to use the shuttle service, so we arranged for a cab to pick us up. The fixed fare from the hotel to Schiphol is 30 Euros - significantly less than the 50+ Euros you'll spend to get from the airport to the center of town. Staff at the hotel were unfailingly pleasant and helpful. They put out a pretty decent breakfast of cereal, croissants and bread, fruit, juice, and coffee or tea, all of which can be enjoyed in the hotel's cheerful breakfast room. In addition, we got some good advice regarding day trips from Amsterdam, as well as recommendations for restaurants in the area. All in all, the staff were a real asset to the hotel. The Hotel Zandbergen fit into our budget and our plans nicely, and I'd recommend it to anyone who wants a reasonably priced three star type room in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: strangerb74
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in April 08. Great basic hotel. The staff we absolutely wonderful. Nothing fancy but nice clean with a good location. Hotel is located in a residential area just south of the city. City is approximately a 15 minute walk, and a five minute walk to the Van Gogh. Very nice neighborhood. The staff was very helpful with travel tips and transport. Breakfast was good and the room was clean and nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4th stay at Zandbergen”
Reviews.Author: Jeffords
Reviews.Content: I just finished my 4th stay at the Hotel Zandbergen. I'm a repeat customer because I like the hotel's location, rooms, and service. The hotel is in an upper middle-class residential area. Quality cafes, shops, and boutiques are just around the corner. Also very close is Vondelpark, Amsterdam's main park and perfect spot for any athletic or leisure activity. A short walk away are the Van Gogh and Rijkes museums, and the Concertgebouw. Further afield is easily accessible via the tram which passes right in front of the hotel. I like the rooms I've stayed in. They are clean and well decorated. The hotel obviously cares - many thoughtful touches are evident. My favorite room has a large balcony overlooking the inner courtyard. The hotel's service is lead by its owner/manager, Henk de Lugt. He is a master of the nearly lost art of hospitality. I actually feel welcomed and well taken care of during my stays. Henk is also a superb source of information on things to see and do, in and out of Amsterdam. I recommend the Hotel Zandbergen to anyone (solo, couple, or family) visiting Amsterdam. Unless you have-to-stay within the canals or simply prefer larger hotels, I don't think you could go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, homey hotel”
Reviews.Author: out_of_VA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 day stay in this lovely little hotel. We travel with three kids, so we need to find a lower priced hotel in order to make 2 rooms affordable. If we stay longer than 2 nights we usually rent an apartment. This hotel/inn filled the bill because we were given a double (2 single beds - oops) and a triple on the same floor - yes the stairs were steep, but they helped us out and even my 10 year old daughter could pretty much do it. The small lobby had a nice place for us to sit as a family and a hearty and healthy breakfast. The manager and anyone who was on duty went out of their way to help us - whether with restaurant recommendations, assistance with public transport, ordering a cab or just ideas of what to do in the cold and rain. I highly recommend this clean, comfortable and homey hotel, unless you are looking for ultra luxury and faceless "international standard" chain-style hotels.... the location, by the way, is a bit farther out than the museums, but a quick walk and definitely out of the madness of the central city - a plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Zandbergen!!”
Reviews.Author: OzintheUK
Reviews.Content: Zanbergen is a very welcoming hotel. A traditional Amsterdam-Style House, which is lovely! The rooms are nice, well-equipped and very clean!! The Staff are extremely nice and helpful! It's a little away from the tourist areas, such as Dam Square, but a 10min walk or 2 minute tram ride will get you there. In a nice area of town. Being a little away from the tourist areas makes for a quite night too! Lovely people, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: QuentinS
Reviews.Content: The Zandbergen more than met all the expectations other reviews here had given us. Friendly and welcoming, clean, neat, tidy. It really is a great location for the museums etc. It's less than 10 minutes' walk to the Van Gogh (and Stedelijk when it reopens), and another minute or two to the Rijksmuseum. Walking another 5 minutes towards the city centre gets you to Leidseplein area, with lots of restaurants and bars. Or a tram from the hotel will take you to the centre in less than 10 minutes, from the tram stop just thirty yards from the hotel. Our double bed room was great, maybe a little compact, but not inconveniently so, with good, non-hotel-chain decor and fittings. Henk and his staff were friendly and helpful, and it says a lot about the Zandbergen that the only negative I can think of about our whole stay is that the light fittings over the bed are in the way if you want to sit up and read!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: USMA1986
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Zandbergen is a clean, comfortable inn-type hotel located just outside the canal rings of Amsterdam. My wife and I recently stayed there the weekend before driving to Germany for business meetings. We were looking for someplace reasonably priced, clean, well run and convenient to a tram line. The Hotel Zandbergen easily met those requirements. The hotel is located on Willensparkweg in a residential neighborhood. This is a high rent district of Amsterdam where very expensive automobiles are commonplace. Neither my wife nor I found this neighborhood to be nearly as busy as some previous reviewers have indicated. The hotel is a two-minute walk from either the Emmastraat or Cornelis Schuytstraat tram stops on Line 2. A tram comes by every 10 minutes and will quickly take you to any place in Amsterdam in 10- 15 minutes. If you were so inclined to walk to Central Station, it would take about 35 minutes. The appeal of the Zandbergen is that it is NOT in the middle of Amsterdam where hoards of noisy tourists and traffic rob the city of its charm. (TIP: If arriving from Schipol, take the train to Station Amsterdam South [World Trade Center], get on Tram 5 towards Amsterdam and get off at the Van Baerlestraat stop. Get on Tram 2 toward Sloten [away from Amsterdam] and go three stops to Emmastraat). The Zandbergen is in a typical Amsterdam dwelling with steep, narrow staircases and no elevator. Older or less fit folks with heavy suitcases could have some issues if no one is around to help. Our very clean, moderately sized room had a nice double bed with comfortable linens. The spotless bathroom was medium sized with modern fixtures and bright, clean tile. There was plenty of closet space. The TV had BBC1 and BBC2 and several other channels in English subtitled in Dutch. Our room even had a large balcony measuring about 16 square meters that looked upon a quiet courtyard. Breakfast was always fresh and ample, and the coffee was fabulous. The owner of the hotel, Henk, is one of the more pleasant people you will encounter anywhere. He is the consummate professional and a wealth of knowledge. And he truly understands service. As an example, one morning I came down right at 0700 for breakfast. Henk was still in the process of setting up. He stopped everything just to make me a cup of coffee without me having to ask. I even received an email from Henk a few days after we departed thanking us for our stay. The Hotel Zandbergen is not a luxury hotel. There are plenty of those in Amsterdam if that is what you are looking for. It is, however, a clean, comfortable and quiet place to stay just a few minutes removed from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. I found it to be a good value and would not hesitate to return on my next visit to Amsterdam. (p.s. If you are looking for a true culinary delight, then do NOT miss Spring Restaurant. It is a two-minute walk from the Zandbergen on the corner of Willensparkweg and Cornelis Schuytstraat. I eat here every time Iâ€™m in Amsterdam and it has always been outstanding. http://www.restaurantspring.nl)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Inn, nice people, but no way a #5 hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peacecow
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel is a little far out and NOT on the Vondelpark, but on the busy Willemstraat a couple of streets over. The Zandbergen is more of an Inn than a hotel as the front desk closes at 10 pm and there are no elevators--very tough, steep stairs, but they DO help you with your bags. The rooms are nice and newly redone, BUT, mine had single beds against the wal that I did not expect. Henk, the owner, is a gem of a person, very nice. As I wanted a full double bed AND access to a computer at any time (the reception closes at 10, as mentioned) I had to move to another hotel. I found a much better facility, nearby at 25% less cost. Now I'd say the fact it was off-season had a lot to do with this. In any event it is a supply and demand situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TLV_Globetrotters
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a week at the Zandbergen in Amsterdam after finding the hotel via tripadvisor.com. The stay could not have been better. The hotel, while not city center, is conveniently situated a few blocks from the main museums. We occupied the penthouse suite, a spacious 2 room apartment on top of the hotel. Henk and the rest of the staff were extremely friendly and efficient. The hotel is spotless, breakfast is tasty and we got useful local tips to make our stay more rewarding. We highly recommend the Zandbergen and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dobedobedo
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews (many thanks to all contributors), my wife and I stayed in the Hotel Zandbergen for 5 nights last month (Nov 07) and had a wonderful time. The hotel is spotless throughout, breakfast is both enjoyable and ample, the owner/manager couldn't be more friendly/helpful and the bedroom TV even had BBC1 and BBC2! As regards location, the hotel is situated in a quiet tree-lined residential area (thankfully well away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Amsterdam) but is easily reached by Tram 2 from Central Station - get off at Emmastraat (3 stops from Van Gogh Museum stop), walk back about 30 yards along tram route (Willemsparkweg) and you're there. Other highlights of our trip were visits to Anne Frank House, Rijksmuseum, Haarlem (lovely town (recommended by hotel owner) about 15 mins by train from Amsterdam Central Station), free Wednesday lunchtime concert in Concertgebouw (also recommended by hotel owner), Museum Amstelkring (aka "Our Lord In The Attic" museum), which is on the fringe of the RLD and (best of all) Museum Speelklok (superb collection of musical boxes, barrel organs, fairground organs etc) in Utrecht (lovely city about 30 mins from Amsterdam Central Station). Finally, if visiting around Christmas, would highly recommend "Christmas Palace" shop at 508-510 Singel (on the flower market) - Beautiful stuff and friendliest shopkeeper ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cutterquick
Reviews.Content: Great place!! Excellent and helpful staff. The coffee in the morning was the best. They sent me accurate directions to get there from the airport and made some very good suggestions on what to see. The manager really looked out for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very helpful staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: juliobsas
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife in this hotel on vacation and we liked it a lot. It is well located (close to the museums and good restaurants). There is a tram stop almost in front of the hotel to go to the city center and the train station. The staff is extremely helpful and they gave us very good recommendations. Just one comment: it does not have any lift (not suprising in Amsterdam though).

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was o.k.”
Reviews.Author: bluestlove
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the penthouse suite at Hotel Zandbergen the last few nights of our honeymoon. The location is actually quite great *because* it is a walk away from the city center's hustle and bustle. Though, it is still relatively close to museums and shopping. Henk is a gracious host and the breakfast was delicious. The penthouse itself may not be worth the walk up the stairs if you wanting 'the best' room in the house. The other rooms seemed enjoyable enough. I would say book the penthouse if you had a family. Negatives: The internet did not work in our room. We had to sit at the bottom of the stairs to use it. There were dirty dishes in the sink when we arrived. They do not replenish towels. The t.v. remote was lost/broken. The shower spilled onto the bathroom floor because the shower doors were leaky. We could not make outgoing calls from our phone, and none of the staff could figure out why. The previous reviews are not exaggerating: the stairs are quite steep and narrow. There is no lift. This was somewhat of a problem, as we had 4 large suitcases. Also, the reception desk is not open all the time. We had to wake up the staff to check out at 6 am.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: davetwo
Reviews.Content: I'm glad to say all the positive reviews of the Hotel Zandbergen are correct. On arrival, my partner â€“ who was unsure about the hotel after seeing some photos of the rooms on a website â€“ was immediately reassured by the spotlessly clean hotel and the extremely warm and helpful staff. I would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Zandbergen again.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give Hotel Zandbergen a 10, I would!”
Reviews.Author: 1hairleft
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel, the owner and staff deserve a 10. My husband and I stayed there for 2 days mid-October and again one day the end of October. We had met in Amsterdam for a 2 week vacation, and returned there to go our separate ways. He works abroad. Prior to departing the US, I had contacted the hotel on a few occasions to make and later to firm up our reservations. Each time, my faxes and/or emails were answered almost immediately with an always pleasant response. Upon arrival, we were instantly impressed by the friendly owner, Henk, who welcomed us with a smile. I had a huge and heavy bag, he grabbed it and took it up the stairs before we knew it! That was the beginning of a warm and wonderful experience for us at this lovely hotel on a beautiful tree-lined cobblestoned street. Our room was clean, bright, cheerful and comfortable. The double size bed was great, no lumps or bumps. We rested well. The view from our window was a lovely garden with a pathway winding thru it. The room temp. was just right. Plenty of towels, soap, shampoo, etc. A blow dryer was also furnished. The electric fan in the room wasn't really needed by us. The breakfast, which was included at no charge, was **delicious**. There was a nice array of fruits, muffins, fresh bread for toasting, boiled eggs, cereals, juices, coffee....you name it! And all served in a cheerful and clean dining area, with freshly pressed linens, near a window that looked out upon the quaint street, Willemsparkweg. Everyone was so accomodating, and we were reminded of the good old days when the customer always came first. They still do at this hotel. When we mentioned the problem of communication we'd had with the hotel in Paris because we don't speak French, Henk immediately called and confirmed our reservations for us...in French! It was as if he and his staff could not do enough for us. The location of the hotel is really great. It is exactly 175 steps (I counted) to the tram pick-up point. Just hop on the number 2 to go a few stops to the Rijks museum and a few more to the Van Gogh museum. Or take a 10 minute ride to the Centraal Railway Station where you can get a tram to almost anywhere in Amsterdam, or a train to almost anywhere in Europe. Very convenient for tourists and it's easy to understand the schedules too.
