On our return trip a few weeks later, we'd gotten caught up in the Rome air traffic controllers strike and our flight was cancelled, so we were a day late arriving. Before we left Rome, I was sick and was SO comforted in knowing that we would be returning to the Zandbergen, where I knew good people would get help for us if we needed it. It is a little frightening being in a foreign country and getting sick. Henk and staff were very gracious about our delayed arrival and were able to accomodate us when we did arrive a day late. It was late in the evening when we arrived, and I was feverish. The desk clerk was an angel. She fixed me a pot of hot tea, put my husband in touch with a physician within minutes, got a cab for him right away to go and pick up medication and translated the instructions for the meds to him. All in all, what could have been a frightful experience was really not much of a problem at all because of the compassion and kindness of Henk and the wonderful staff at the Zandbergen. After all, employees handle situations as they are trained to do, and the night clerk was very well prepared help us, and for that we thank her and her employer. Everyone there went far beyond the call of duty, and I'm sure we are not in the minority. If you stay at Hotel Zandbergen, I am confident that your experience with be just as phenomenal as ours was. We told them if we ever have another chance to visit Amsterdam, we would not want to stay anywhere but the Zandbergen. And that is a sincere sentiment for us. I have to tell you, I have mixed feelings about leaving this review. I know it will improve Hotel Zandbergen's score, and it would not surprise me to see that this hotel has become the #1 top rated hotel in Amsterdam very soon. But if that happens....they'll be so booked that we won't be able to get reservations there in the future! All I can say is, you will not regret it if you decide to stay at this hotel. We send our warmest regards to **all** of the folks there, and we thank them for taking such good care of us. P.S.... I thought I had taken some pix of the gorgeous bathrooms with gray and maroon ceramic tiles, but I can't find them. If anyone has pix of the bathrooms, please post them. The bathrooms are really pretty!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: oceanDelrayBeach
Reviews.Content: We have never returned home after a trip to Europe finding ourselves talking at greater length about our lodging facilities than the cultural moments we had & historic sites we visited in our destination city. Henk D. de Lugt & his staff made us feel welcome every minute of the day throughout our 2 week stay at their lovely Amsterdam hotel. The upbeat, warm & friendly approach from all of them was a wonderful exposure to the people of the Netherlands and is for us the most meaningful experience we can have in a country new to us. Couple this with spotless rooms, fine breakfast offerings, spacious bathroom facilities, peaceful surroundings in a relatively quiet neighborhood, easy tram access to all parts of the city and you have the formula for a perfect vacation. We can never adequately thank the folks at the Zandbergen for their travel trips, dining advice and hospitality. We just hope to be able to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth sailing at Zandbergen”
Reviews.Author: pigletthepug
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel with husband and 2.5 year old in Oct 2007. We received a room on the 2nd floor (3rd floor to Americans). It had 2 twin beds pushd together and something of a cross between a twin bed and a sofa. The room was sparkling clean, but no denying that it is tiny. It overlooks a common garden and fellow neighbors in the back....so it's quiet. There is a computer with free hispeed Internet in the lobby. The locations is very very close to the number 2 train, which takes you everywhere. BUT, its not close to Leidsplein. We stayed at Hestia....a very comparable hotel that is much closer to the Leidsplein. Zandbergen is in a nice residential area. You can also ask them to do your laundry for you at 7.5 euro per load. All in all, a very pleasant stay. I would recommend this place if you are interested in museums. But, it's a bit further from Leidsplein area.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent find”
Reviews.Author: jdbri
Reviews.Content: I returned from a three-night stay at Hotel Zandbergen yesterday and I was very impressed. Henk, the owner, is very friendly and helpful, as are all his staff; nothing seemed to be too much trouble to them and they readily volunteered additional useful information to questions I asked. The included breakfast is typical Dutch, and of very good quality. The buffet consists of excellent ham, cheeses, bread/toast and rolls, croissants, jam, cereals, fresh fruits, hard-boiled egg, juice and tea or coffee. My room was spotless (as was the rest of the hotel) and the mini-bar reasonably priced. My only slight complaint is that both my brother and I found our beds to be a little on the soft side. The hotel is close to the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijsmuseum. It's a little way out of the city centre, but it's close enough to walk in, especially if a cafÃ© break is taken half-way. Regular, frequent trams travel to and from the centre from close to the hotel. I liked the Zandbergen and I won't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ibpeo
Reviews.Content: In the spring of 2007 four of us senior citizens booked four rooms at the Hotel Zandbergen not really believing that this little jewel would live up to the praise that it had received. We stayed for 6 nights. The truth is that we all were so very pleasantly surprised. Our rooms, while small, were spotless, efficient and wonderful. We all would stay there again; in fact, one of our group has booked another stay and is taking her husband this time. Of course, she has booked one of the larger rooms since they will be sharing. The breakfast buffet was wonderful; we had a great variety of things from which to choose, and the coffee was delicious (something you don't always find.) This hotel is convenient to the tram; it is withing walking distance of many wonderful things; restaurants are very handy if you want to eat in the neighborhood; and, having free access to the internet is a huge plus! The hotel staff couldn't have been more fantastic. Each one was helpful and really seemed concerned that we enjoy ourselves. They helped us find good restaurants and arranged tours for us, and when they all gathered 'round to say goodbye at the end of our week-long stay, their comments were genuine. We all would recommend The Hotel Zandbergen highly. It is all they claim it to be. ~~Stu A.

Reviews.Title: “Charming welcome to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rrave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Zandbergen for two nights and were very pleased with our room and the service provided by Henk and staff. We took the train from the airport to Central Station and then Tram 2 that stops only Â½ block past the hotel. With the tram stop so close, we bought a 48 hour tram pass and used it to travel all over Amsterdam for the next two days. We arrived before our room was ready so Henk said we could sit in the breakfast room to wait until we could check-in. He served us tea and made many great recommendations while we waited. Our spotless room was up two steep staircases from the reception but Henk carried up our luggage so was not a problem. The room had two large windows that faced the street and it was light and bright. We enjoyed listening to and watching the street scene below especially the bicyclists! The bathroom was good size with plenty of hot water. The beds were comfortable and pillows soft. The breakfast buffet was delicious and was constantly being restocked by the attentive staff. The internet connection was fast and for those without a laptop, there was a PC in the lobby. We couldn't have asked for a more delightful hotel for our first nights of our first trip to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Stanislov
Reviews.Content: Based on T.A.'s reviews, I booked a room at this hotel a couple of months before my trip. I was not disappointed. The location was great, very close to Vondelpark, Van Gogh and Rijks museums, and only a 25-30 min walk to Amsterdam's center (Dam Square). As mentioned in earlier posts, there's a tram (#2) out front that can take you downtown if walking's not your thing. I had a small single room in the front of the building, which although a little noisy at night, was very clean and comfortable. Staff are only too happy to try and accommodate any requests (eg, extra pillow, extra blanket, etc.) . They also arranged pickup with the airport bus. Having the ample breakfast included was very convenient as well. Staff made some recommendations for restaurants in the area, but I happened on to Brasserie Bark opposite Museumplein, which had excellent seafood. Overall, Hotel Zandbergen made by 3 day stay in Amsterdam most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lisa928
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week-long stay at this lovely little hotel in the Vondelpark area of Amsterdam. The location is ideal, a little quieter than being in the center of the city, but within a few steps of the #2 tram. The staff were so friendly and helpful, especially the manager Henk. He made it a point to chat with guests during breakfast, asking about their plans for the day and making excellent recommendations. I stayed in a single room, which was small but still felt comfortable. Very clean. Also the fact that the hotel is non-smoking was wonderful. As for dining, the included breakfast was pretty basic but fine for me. There were also several nice restaurants in the neighborhood, including the Sardegna Italian restaurant (very affordable) and the Brasserie Setz (a bit more expensive). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariaShepperton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and would recommend it and would definitely stay there again. We booked a 4 bedded room but were upgraded to the 'penthouse' suite at no extra cost as the room we booked was not available. The 'suite' was really great, very spacious and there was a kitchen with microwave, fridge etc and a large flat screen TV and a CD player with a great range of CD's. It also had a lovely balcony. The hotel is in a quiet residential location but within easy access of everything by foot or tram. It is very close to Vondelpark and I went running there early in the morning which was great. The breakfast was lovely plenty of choice and fresh produce. There is internet access in reception and the staff are very pleasant and helpful. Overall it was very good value and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, surprised at high ranking”
Reviews.Author: d_kester
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Room was good, staff was helpful, breakfast was fine, price typical for Amsterdam. First room we had faced the street and was noisy (middle of summer, so we had the window open; no air conditioning), but they moved us to a room in the back which was very quiet. Hotel location was pretty good, in a pleasant up-scale neighborhood a bit away from the center of town. The tram goes right by the hotel, and the Van Gogh and Rijks museums are a 10 minute walk away. It was nice to be away from the crowds in the city center. I must say that I am surprised at the very high ranking the hotel received (#6 in Amsterdam as of middle of 2007). While the hotel was fine, I would be surprised if it was the 6th best hotel in all of Amsterdam. Maybe this says something about the other Amsterdam hotels. I think one reason for the high rating is that no one had anything particularly bad to say about the hotel. No one said it was fantastic, but no one had any major complaints. (There is the possibilty that the owners wrote positive reviews to increase their rating, but I doubt this. What I read in the other reviews sounds honest, and I would agree with what they wrote). In summary, I would recommend this hotel, but don't expect something as wonderful as their very high ranking would indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Little hotel in a nice nighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: chloeshiny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a single room for 2 nights.It was a pleasant experience.Museum area is just 5 minutes walk away, the central station is around 10 tram stops,and takes around 15 minutes.Also it is near vondelpark,so it is ideal if you want to see this pleasant part of Amsterdam. My room was in the entrance floor,a regular small Amsterdam hotel room,but very close to reception.If you are the type of the person who wakes up for every noise,this room might be a problem. They prepare breakfast in the morning,and phones in the reception are ringing,so it gets a little noisy.However,if you close the second door in the room,it reduces the noise. It was not a problem for me cos i dont mind noise and i woke up early. My bed was very comfortable,pillows were big,and there was also extra blanket in the room. Bathroom was clean and tidy.I also had a reasonably priced minibar.Wireless was fast,the hotel staff was extremely sweet and helpful,breakfast was really fresh and tasty. So i had everything i needed. I booked via booking.com and had a last minute price,which was 75 euros for single room. The real price of the room is around 95 euros,which i think was a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A well-located little place”
Reviews.Author: REL18
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little place. We were very glad we stayed there, and would stay there again when we next go to Amsterdam. The owners are very pleasant and helpful (which from our experience is typical of the Dutch!). The stairs are QUITE steep and the room was kind of wee, but all rooms look the same when you're asleep; I didn't come to Amsterdam to sit in the room. The beds were comfortable, the place was clean, the bathroom was tidy and fully functional and the included breakfast was very good. That's what matters. The location is terrific; very close to the Rijksmuseum & the Van Gogh museum. It's right on the streetcar line, so it's v. easy to get to from Schipol. I would wholeheartedly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: Donnyrover99
Reviews.Content: Absolutely excellent- great welcome, service, advice, breakfast and location! What more could you ask for from a hotel of this size? We had a lovely five day break in Amsterdam with the Zandbergen being a superb location from which to enjoy the delights of the city.

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: HMCIllinois_USA
Reviews.Content: It was a truly fine place to stay....almost a B&B, with more privacy. Henk was an efficent, attentive manager/host. The breakfast was fresh and delicious. the baking done near reception, and the fragrance lured. The coffee was excellent, the fruit fresh.....the flowers, too. Henk had some appealing tourist suggestions for vistors. The room was bright, roomy by European standards, and immaculate....as was the bathroom. Housekeeping was perfect. The stairs were steep, but not impossible, and there are rooms on the lower floor. The neighborood is quite pleasnt, beautiful housing skirting the famous Vondel Park, and wonderful small shops for browsing, eating. The tram is on the corner, but walking to museums and canals is easy. The price is right, the location is right, the ambiance, delightful. We would stay nowhere else in Amsterdam. H & K Illinois USA

Reviews.Title: “Henk rules! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MangoNole
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Amsterdam in July 07 and stayed at this charming little hotel. It was a real treat! First the good- The owner/proprietor/manager Henk is a super-fantastic guy, very helpful and proto-typically Dutch efficient. The rest of the staff was good too when he wasn't there. The room was clean, well appointed. Hotel is very safe and the area around it is pleasant/upscale. The breakfast was good, the internet access was great. Overall, the hotel itself was probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at while in Europe that I paid for myself (I've stayed in better hotels but only when using an expense account). The bad (or maybe the "less than good")- The hotel is a GOOD 40 minute walk from Central Station, and easily 30 minutes or more from Dam Square. It's close to the art museums, but from the "fun stuff" it's a distance. Normally not a big deal because the tram stop is close to the hotel, but the trams stop running at midnight and bus service after that time is spotty. My wife and I stay out til 2 one night and had to walk back in the rain. Other than that...great place. Would I reccomend it? Unless you have to be within close distance of the RLD/Dam Square, YES. But next time...I might try to get a place closer in so there's not so much walking...either that, or I'll rent a bike. But the hotel itself...OUTSTANDING.

Reviews.Title: “Truly great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisrel
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the hotel on two different occasions over a two week period (entering and leaving Amsterdam). We were originally set up to stay at another hotel when we were leaving Amsterdam but canceled that reservation based on our first visit. I can say without hesitation that the experience of staying here was the best I've ever had (having stayed in hundreds of hotels across the world). Henk and the staff go above and beyond to make you feel at home and are extremely attentive and helpful. The service was simply amazing. The location of the hotel was convenient both to downtown (short tram ride or walk) and to the airport. In addition there is a very nice (large) park that is a very short distance from the hotel. Our children greatly enjoyed playing there. I would strongly recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “1st class hotel”
Reviews.Author: davegaijin
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, friendly, clean, staff very helpful. Situated in a quiet part of town, near to parks and museum. You can buy a ticket for the Van Gough museum form the hotel - saves you queuing! Very highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends!”
Reviews.Author: Jamdoughnut
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4, and had the fantastic experience of staying in this friendly, comfortable and clean hotel for 2 nights recently. We had a 4 bedded room which opened out onto a small patio at the back of the hotel. The room was spacious and beautifully clean and very quiet. The hotel was only a 2 minute walk to Amsterdam's fantastic tram network, so you can reach the centre of Amsterdam in under 10 minutes. Breakfast was plentiful and a great choice. The manager, Henk, made us feel like old friends, offering us coffee and juice for the children as we arrived, suggesting suitable places to visit and even giving us ready printed directions for getting to the airport at the end of the stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a comfortable, friendly environment, and we hope to return ourselves soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Kacey83
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights. The room was beautiful, the ensuite was spacious, all staff were extremely friendly, helpful, pleasant. The breakfast was lovely. They also had a computer which the internet was provided for free. The hotel is a short tram ride to all the tourist attractions and the lively Leidseplein and Casino. In fact, a couple of times which actually walked the distance as it is not that far. We even walked to the Van Gogh Museum. I would stay here again and would definitely recommend this to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: floridamember_7
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at Hotel Zandbergen and found it absolutely delightful. My single room, which overlooked the street, was clean, comfortable, and totally quiet at night. The location was excellent, a 10-minute tram ride to Dam Square. Manager and staff were most gracious and professional. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: JDHall7
Reviews.Content: We were at Hotel Zandbergen for five nights in mid-May 2007. Our two twin bed room, #5, was on the second level, rear, overlooking the garden. Very clean, quiet, comfortable. Getting to center city was no problem; the tram #2 stop is half a block away. Strip tickets for use on all trams may be purchased at the hotel. Airport bus, Connexxion, goes to the hotel. Breakfast buffet was substantial and good. Many fine restaurants located in the residential area of the hotel; especially Palma. My wife needed medical attention during our stay; the hotel made a special effort to arrange an appointment with a doctor. Hotel Zandbergen is in a perfect location; near the concert hall and museums, but away from center city congestion. We will return to Hotel Zandbergen. Outstanding and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: greenilltravellers
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very impressed with this hotel having read all the reviews on Tripadvisor, we couldn't fault it at all. We asked for a room at the back and as my friend has some mobility problems we were given a twin room downstairs, with french doors opening onto a small garden. The weather was poor so we couldn't take advantage of sitting outside. Our room was spotlessly clean with comfortable beds, t.v ,a minibar and a kettle and teamaking facilities was offered., The room was average size, but we were not in it for long. Everywhere was well maintained, the furnishings modern. The breakfast was adequate, with cereals, fruit. ,yoghurt,rolls bread, cheese, eggs and ham, fruit juice, tea or coffee. All the staff were extremely polite and helpful.The manager , Henk de Lugt was charming. Nothing was too much trouble. I have special dietary requirements so the receptionist checked that a local restaurant could help me out, then they booked us a table. We loved Amsterdam, and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: panda16465
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Amsterdam and we stayed at this charming hotel. It truly was excellent. The hotel is situated just a short tram ride from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam, which is good, so it makes it quiet to sleep and a pleasure to come back home to. The trams run very frequently right outside the hotel so that is not a problem (and if you are worried about the noise from the trams, they have very good double glazing and you can hardly hear them). The service at the hotel was impeccable. Run by a very nice family where nothing is too much trouble. There is a continental breakfast included with the price of the room and it was excellent - cereals, fresh meats & cheeses, eggs, yoghurt and the most delicious fresh rolls with butter and jam. The hotel is situated about 3 minutes from the Van Gogh museum and Rijks Museum where you can see numerous works of art by both Van Gogh and Rembrandt. Vondel Park is just around the corner for a relaxing stroll after a hard day. The stairs are quite steep though in the hotel which might make it difficult for some as there is no elevator (however, every museum house that we went in was the same - a trend in Amsterdam). I cannot fault this hotel at all and would totally recommend it to anyone who is visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PetalIreland
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Zandbergen hotel from the 17th - 20th May and we were very impressed with it. The location while being out of the centre of Amsterdam is still good. It is within walking distance of the museum quarter and the number 2 tram stops very close to the hotel. After a hectic day in the centre it was nice to come back to somewhere that was quiet. The hotel was very nice and the staff were extremely helpful. The hotel and our room were very clean and the bathroom was good however the shower heads were not the best as they tended to get the floor of the bathroom wet. The hotel is no smoking however we stayed in a very nice room with a balcony (where you can smoke) towards the back of the hotel. The gentleman that was there in the morning was very nice and helpful and gave us good tips about places that we wanted to visit. For example we got our tickets for the Van Gogh Museum at the hotel and did not have to queue at all then which was great. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay and the hotel was very nice I would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spacecoast
Reviews.Content: Just like all of the other reviews, this hotel is fantastic. The location is great, as it is in a great residential area, but is still close enough to walk directly into the center of the city. Also, the Number 2 tram stop is extremely convenient. And for those of you wondering, you can purchase a fair directly on the tram at the point of entry for 1.6 euros. OK... Back to the hotel... The rooms are average size by European standards, but are extremely clean and well maintainted. The beds are some of the most comfortable we have ever had in a hotel and the pillows are superior. As many have stated, the stairs are step, but do give you a great workout to burn off all of the extra calories you will be drinking... I mean eating. The breakfasts are very good, and very convenient after a long night of fun. But the one thing that sets this hotel apart is the fact that the staff are all amazing. They were extremely accomodating and helpful no matter what we asked. They even lent us a bedsheet so we could take to Vondelpark for a picnic. We absolutely loved Amsterdam, and this hotel is what helped make it even that much more special. Also, for the ladies, make sure you go to the lingerie shop just up the street. I think the name is Marline Dekkers. It is on the pricey side, but the lingerie is amazing. And the girls that work there, especially Roxanne and Anna are fantastic. And if you go, tell them the crazy couples from Florida say Hi!

Reviews.Title: “Up there with the Best”
Reviews.Author: lfcmad2002
Reviews.Content: Second time i have stayed at this hotel.This time i took my Parents with me to sample the Amsterdam Life. This hotel is in a great location.Only a tram ride away (Number 2) from Central Station (1.60 Euro)or you can get a shuttle bus from Airport direct to hotel (19.50 Return). Its in a residential area that has a police station a couple of yards down road (Safe area) A nice pub on corner,as well as being across from Vondalpark The owners and staff are all very friendly. The rooms are clean and well maintained. If you can get a room at rear even better. My father was suffering from severe Ciatica when we got there and was given a loan of a walking Stick from the very nice gentleman behind desk I will be back Tips: If eldery,but mobile then ask in advance for a room downstairs as it easier to get to then upstairs,as like most places in Amsterdam they have steep stairs

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, my best hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just spent a week at the lovely Hotel Zandbergen. I have been to Europe numerous times and have stayed in a number of different accomodations. This was my sister's first time to Europe. We were both thrilled with our choice of the Zandbergen. The B&B lies between Museumplein and Vondelpark. The neighborhood is residential and very very quiet. There are two tram stops on the #2 line within about 100 feet of the front door. The #2 runs to Centraal Station and just about anywhere else youâ€™re going to want to go in the city center. The longest it took us to get to Centraal Station was about 18 minutes. So you have the convenience of accessibility with the comfort of a nice, quiet residential area. The hotel itself has secure access, which is another plus for females traveling alone. The room was dead quiet and immaculately clean. We had room #19 off the lobby, but there was a main door to our room, a short hallway with a bathroom, then another door into our room. The double doors helped squelch any lobby noise we may have heard (which was none!). The two single beds were comfortable and the room was cool even on the three hot days we were there. Breakfasts were buffet style and ran the gamut to all cold offering (cereal, pastry, meats, fruit) and hard boiled eggs which the host did as you waited. The coffee was out of this world. Oooh la la! The host has recently taken the hotel over from the Vonks, who Iâ€™d never met but had read about extensively on Trip Advisor. Youâ€™d never know that he was new to this business, if he is new to it. He is incredibly hospitable, knows when to offer up information and how much to tell you, is eager to answer questions and was genuinely interested in seeing that our experience was all that we had hoped. We were treated like royalty. It was a very warm and comfortable environment, and this carries over the rest of his staff as well. As my sister said, "it felt like we were coming home every night." I cannot recommend this B&B enough. In many, many trips to Europe, this was my best accommodation experience. Hands down.

Reviews.Title: “All a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: StratfordianUk
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 4 nights at this hotel with my 83 year old father. We could not have wished for a better experience. The ownership of the hotel changed this week so we met both the old and new owners and found them all to be so helpful and thoughtful. Due to dad's age I had emailed in advance to ask that he had a room with the minimum amount of stairs (I knew from the hotel's website there was no lift and some stairs were inevitable). I received a prompt reply telling me that the lowest room would be one flight up and would that be ok, thus giving us a chance to change our booking if necessary. I also rang on the day we were arriving to ask for a kettle in his room, again no problem. Throughout our stay we were made to feel most welcome, lots of information was available about things to do both in terms of leaflets and books but also from the owners. At breakfast everyone seemed to be greeted in their own language and a real interest taken in what they wanted to do and advice offered as to how best to do it. Free internet access in reception was also a real bonus. I note another visitor felt that the lack of security on this PC was an issue, I would suggest that most people were only checking news, the cricket/football scores and their emails. Security should not be particularly compromised here. If you are doing stuff that requires a high level of security a public computer is not the best place to do it! The rooms were very clean with reasonable sized en suite shower rooms. We both had single rooms and the beds were larger than normal single beds and very comfortable. The hotel felt very secure as the front door is always locked, your room key is also a front door key. The hotel is by the number 2 tram line so access into the city is fast and easy if you don't wish to walk (about 20 minutes walk to the Rijksmuseum). The hotel is in a pleasant residential area with some shops around of the organic veg, homemade bread/chocolates variety, lovely to browse in. The beautiful and massive Vondel Park is just over the road. I would really recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to get out of the city centre and get away from the anonymous large hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: rcepuch
Reviews.Content: A very friendly place with terrific Internet access on a terminal just beyond the check-in desk, where no one else ever seemed to notice it so I had no problems getting on whenever I liked. The rooms here are small but clean and efficient. Warning: There's no lift and the stairs are steep, so if you may regret choosing this hotel if you have a heavy bag. The neighborhood is relatively quiet, not far from the museums but a more ambitious walk from the center of town. Still, if you're a walker (or a tram rider), this hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Go in full confidence. Is a 4*- hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Savvy-tourist
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Zandbergen Hotel in the mid of February 2007. Booking: I searched the internet for a reasonable deal. Some hotels I used to stay became too expensive like Golden Tulip or the experience was terrible like Eden Best Western. I found good reviews about Zandbergen Hotel and I called them by phone. I realized later that if for me was a comfortable time to call in Amsterdam was 7AM. Nevertheless, a feminine voice answered promptly. I explained what I wanted, a single room, quiet, higher floor, no smoking, no pets. And, that I would rather not put my credit card on their Internet site. To my surprise, the front desk kindly agreed. The next day, I called again and sent all the information by fax. They promptly confirmed my reservation by e-mail. So far, so good. The airport arrival: I went directly to the Tourist Information Center in Amsterdam Airport. I asked for a shuttle bus return ticket for Zandbergen Hotel. The lady at the desk had no clue where the hotel was. I told her to call (I had the phone no.) and she answered that a local call is too expensive. (Stunning answer !). Finally, she looked on the Internet and found the exact address. Travel by minibus OK. Hotel arrival: on the right hand side of the door is an interphone. You have to call the front desk in order to open the door. (for this reason, is good to inform them in advance your estimated arrival time). In the lobby, surveillance cameras. Very good security. At the entrance hall and near the front desk plenty of leaflets with Amsterdam attractions. (I stayed in Hilton Amsterdam a few days ago and they did not have such a collection). Front desk: at the front desk a fair hair lady was working: the Owner. Very polite she confirmed the reservation and checked the credit card. My room was on the third floor and in no time to my embarrassment she took my hand luggage and carried it to the room. My "hand luggage", I think, was weighing more than 12 kilos ! In the reception room is a computer with Internet access. The keyboard is clean. But no antivirus or anti-spyware programs present. A bit unsafe. I told the owner about that, the answer was not convincing. The steps to my room: were steep and rather narrow especially with my 25 kg. suitcase. Some reviewers complained about that and I can confirm. If you are in a wheelchair or pregnant in the last month is not for you. But, if you ask help probably they woud provide. The room: I had a room facing backyard that is an immense garden between the buildings. The room was very quiet. Size: On the smaller side. Some paint peeling, but very discrete. A very large bed (double - at reception I was told that I was upgraded). Very good ! Closet rather old. The carpet very clean, I could walk bare foot. What a reliefâ€¦The window very large looked directly into the bathroom's door. Beware young couples ! In the closet a blanket that did not smell of dump (very nice surprise) and I used during the chilly night. The lighting above the desk strange and ugly. The TV set (rather old) somewhere at over 2 meters on the wall ! Above the bed and practically under your pillow, the light switches and an electric socket (200 V). Dangerous and bizarre position. Do not go in bed with wet hair, metal clips or allow kids with metallic toys. Some electric short may happen earlier than in 1000000 years. The room has a dial-up connection that is obsolete and it seems that has a wireless also. I did not check the wireless though. The bathroom: rather large given the room's size. With a huge mirror. In the bathtub a rubber carpet to protect against losing your footing. Very good for elderly. No mold even on the shower curtain. Very clean everywhere. The bathroom's amenities kit correct and very nice arranged. I got an electronic key for the door and that should be also be used for the street door. I had the laptop with me with a lot of data but I left it in my room. I felt I was in a very safe environment. ( keep the key with you at all times). Dinner: the owner explained a bit about the area and I went out. At the right at the first street corner I found a Brasserie that served a nice chicken salad and a good beer for a good price and friendly service. The Italian restaurant that I found in the neighborhood was empty and did not appeal to me. Searching for a dinner place I could see the area bit. It seems that is not mixed, only a single minority is living there (I won't mention which, in order not to offend anyone). The area has a lot of character even is rather far from the center), with lots of small shops. I have to say that I felt safe even after sun set. Returning, I passed the hotel and stopped at the other corner (left of the hotel). There is a lively bar there with a lot of conversations going on. On the front street, a tram that takes you directly to the Central Station. Breakfast: correct and good. The breakfast room is practically connected with the reception room. On the wall real pictures and drawings by local artists. One drawing inappropriate by my taste, shows a chair thrown through the kitchen's window. Criticism is rather difficult in this hotel: do not forget that the owners live also in this house ! On the tables, real flowers. I was touched. What wasn't functional: the coffee machine. Something huge, like an industrial one with lots of push buttons. You had to call the receptionist to operate it ! Cut all the appetite. A small hot plate with easy operation could have more charm and use. Also no decaffeinated available. I met the Owner (the male). I explained my opinion concerning the switches and the socket under the pillow. His is not very patient in listening clients' opinions as one reviewer pointed out and also his explanation was poor, about expensive investment etc. That talk was a kind of disappointing for me. Telephones: I had to make some international calls using the hotel's phone. The program that is charging the calls is rather slow and I was about to leave the hotel without paying some of my calls. Very embarrassing. Make your calls at least a few hours before leaving. The hotel has 2 penthouse apartments that can be a choice for longer stays and also a kind of 2 bedroom family apartments on the first floor. What is special about the latter is their access to the back garden from which the kids can not venture into the street. Interesting option, but I could not see any of them because they were taken. To summarize: is a very good family hotel, very secure and quiet. Room and bathroom very clean, breakfast good, service very good. At least strange, and also with potential danger the socket and the switch into the room. For this reason is a 4 star- (4*-) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Amsterdam hotel!”
Reviews.Author: seattleμnich
Reviews.Content: We called and booked this hotel while on the road, and we were so happy with it!! I had written a few hotels and numbers down after reviewing tripadvisor comments and hotel recommendations. FYI- Hotel Brouwer was another one we liked, but they ONLY take email reservations. Hotel Zandbergen is not directly in the downtown area, but in more of a neighborhood. It is next to all the musuems ('museum district') and has a tram running into town right at the doorstep (maybe 5 min to the dom?). There are cute restaurants on the block and a little grocery store. The hotel: One of the best nights sleep and beds we've had in a hotel! FREE breakfast, and not stale muffins and bad coffee. The owners serve you good coffee/tea, and you have a great little breakfast buffet to choose from. Free internet and computer in the lobby, and plenty of good recommendations and tips by the staff. They have street parking, and are a block away from the technical city limit, so your nights are free. However, we parked in the stadium garage they recommended for 5euros a day, and was perfect for our 3 day stay (just a tram ride away, maybe 10 min). Our room was #4 (105 euros/night + tax) and pictures are attached. You'll see the beds are apart, which isnt the case in all the rooms, but we booked late. My husband and I are used to pushing european singles together though, so it was no big deal. And the best surprise in the world, we had no problems with the 'crack'! Usually one of us is slipping into it or the covers are a pain, but these beds stuck together and was like sleeping on a regular double bed. The frame was pretty heavy and they weren't on rollers. Truly, I was amazed. Since their Saturday was booked, we changed on our last night to the only room available- the penthouse! : ) Was 165 euros + tax, and I've also attached pics. We cant recommend this hotel enough for a great trip to Amsterdam! Enjoy. (Great restaurants we found: Casa Peru, Los Pilones, Soup Enzo-lunch, Oriental City. Am sure you can look them up online for addresses. All have vegetarian and meat lover options!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: acstewart25
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Amsterdam for a 2 day stay and booked the Hotel a few weeks in advance. What can i say, all the reviews are true! The Hotel is great, very clean, good breakfast and the staff couldn't help you enough (advice for trips, eating etc). Its about 10 mins on the no.2 tram to the centre and about 18mins to the station. Its just down the road from the van gogh museum and Leidseplein (pubs, comedy club, hard rock cafe, Casino etc). I got a 3 day tram pass from the GVA office directly across from the Central Station for about 13 euros which is very handy. Just stamp it the first time you get on a tram then you just have to flash it to the ticket inspector/driver every time you get on a tram after that. If you've never been before, you're only meant to get onto a tram through some doors (front and second from back) and get off through the others. I only write this cause we got left at a stop as we were standing waiting on the wrong door to open!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Zandbergen”
Reviews.Author: E897
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Zandbergen many times during the last 14 years and we love it! We discovered it during our frequent visits to my aging aunt who lived in the neighborhood. The location is perfect! It's right across from the Vondel Park, near the Museumplein and Concertgebauw and on the #2 Tram line. Around the block is a delightful shopping street with upscale cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, boutiques and specialty shops. We were there for a week in October and continue to be amazed by the charm, the cleanliness, the tasteful art and the tasty breakfast! We've watched this hotel get better year by year and each upgrade has added to the beauty and quality. The rooms in the back overlook a lovely garden. The best part of the Hotel Zandbergen are the owners, Margaret and Robert Vonk. They are gracious, helpful, knowledgable, patient, accomodating and, over the years, have become dear friends. No wonder we love the Hotel Zandbergen so much!

Reviews.Title: “penthouse”
Reviews.Author: johninie
Reviews.Content: we got off at the wrong tramstop and had a longish walk to the hotel with luggage and our seven year old daughter. check in was straightforward but we had to be upgraded to the penthouse for the first of our 4 nights there, as our room was being occupied a day longer by its guest. it took us about a millisecond to decide to pay the small extra charge to stay in this" apartment" for the rest of our stay, after we had been shown to it. it is groovy. spacious, light filled and private (it occupies all of the top floor) and is in a very smart part of amsterdam. breakfast was excellent. i can't recommend this highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: frenchalps2011
Reviews.Content: Stay here! As a couple visiting Amsterdam we were bewildered with how many hotel options there are around, especially on this site. Truth is we tried all the hotels listed on Trip Advisor until we came to number 11 in the list - Zandbergen. We both have very high standards when it comes to where we choose to stay and believe me the Zandbergen meets and exceeds those high standards. Its in the most beautiful area of Amsterdam, the museum quarter which in itself should be a visitor attraction - but it isn't, making it a peaceful location right next to Vondelpark and 15 mins walk to the centre. The hotel service was great. From the minute you arrive you can see how the owners cherish their hotel and keep it working, clean and friendly from the start of your stay until the very end. We will definately be back. Neil Robb Edinburgh, Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Like home.”
Reviews.Author: uniquegail
Reviews.Content: Friends who have stayed here for many years arranged for my stay. It was like going home. The owners and the staff are always available for assistance but unintrusive. The location is very convenient for walking, biking or taking public transportation. The breakfast is simple yet top quality.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: george1
Reviews.Content: nice place ,good directions from airport ,tram stop just outside (very quiet location) the only problem was our room was very small, but they very very very clean, comfortable bed and pillows would stay there again and recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: damsqu
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean, bright and airy hotel. Location next to Vondel park is excellent and so convenient, on Tram 2â€™s route. The surrounding posh shopping district was a real find. The cleaning staff did a great job as I donâ€™t think I have seen a bathroom sparkle like that before, even in 5star! My only very small â€˜niggleâ€™ was the shower in my single room was pretty useless. I recognised it was a water saving shower, which is great, but it was hard work trying to wash under it! Best cup of morning coffee in Amsterdam. Many thanks for a lovely stayâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Anticipated departure because of a back problem”
Reviews.Author: torea
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 2 days (instead of 4) in july in this hotel. The hotel is clean and the breakfast is good. The location is very interesting in a lovely street. But, we need to go back 2 days before because my wife was very sick. We had to paid the totality of the next two days (300 euros for an appartment), it's not fairplay in my opinion. Business is business;)

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Zandbergen
HotelInfo.Address: Willemsparkweg 205, Amsterdam 1071 HB, The Netherlands
